Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:74: He selecteth for His mercy whom He will.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:75: Among the People of the Scripture there is he who, if thou trust him with a weight of treasure, will return it to thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:76: Nay, but (the chosen of Allah is) he who fulfilleth his pledge and wardeth off (evil); for lo! Allah loveth those who ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:77: Lo! those who purchase a small gain at the cost of Allah’s covenant and their oaths, they have no portion in the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:78: And lo! there is a party of them who distort the Scripture with their tongues, that ye may think that what they say is from the Scripture, when it is not from the Scripture.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:79: It is not (possible) for any human being unto whom Allah had given the Scripture and wisdom and the prophethood that he should afterwards have said unto mankind: Be slaves of me instead of Allah; but (what he said was): Be ye faithful servants of the Lord by virtue of your constant teaching of the Scripture and of your constant study thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:80: And he commanded you not that ye should take the angels and the prophets for lords.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:81: When Allah made (His) covenant with the prophets, (He said): Behold that which I have given you of the Scripture and knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:82: Then whosoever after this shall turn away: they will be miscreants.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:83: Seek they other than the religion of Allah, when unto Him submitteth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and unto Him they will be returned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:84: Say (O Muhammad): We believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto us and that which was revealed unto Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the tribes, and that which was vouchsafed unto Moses and Jesus and the prophets from their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:85: And whoso seeketh as religion other than the Surrender (to Allah) it will not be accepted from him, and he will be a loser in the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:86: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and (after) they bore witness that the messenger is true and after clear proofs (of Allah’s Sovereignty) had come unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:87: As for such, their guerdon is that on them rests the curse of Allah and of angels and of men combined.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:89: Save those who afterward repent and do right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:90: Lo! those who disbelieve after their (profession of) belief, and afterward grow violent in disbelief: their repentance will not be accepted.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:91: Lo! those who disbelieve, and die in disbelief, the (whole) earth full of gold would not be accepted from such an one if it were offered as a ransom (for his soul).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:92: Ye will not attain unto piety until ye spend of that which ye love.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:93: All food was lawful unto the Children of Israel, save that which Israel forbade himself, (in days) before the Torah was revealed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:94: And whoever shall invent a falsehood after that concerning Allah, such will be wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:96: Lo! the first Sanctuary appointed for mankind was that at Becca, a blessed place, a guidance to the peoples;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:97: Wherein are plain memorials (of Allah’s guidance); the place where Abraham stood up to pray; and whosoever entereth it is safe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:98: Say: O People of the Scripture! Why disbelieve ye in the revelations of Allah, when Allah (Himself) is Witness of what ye do ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:99: Say: O People of the Scripture! Why drive ye back believers from the way of Allah, seeking to make it crooked, when ye are witnesses (to Allah’s guidance) ? Allah is not unaware of what ye do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:100: O ye who believe! If ye obey a party of those who have received the Scripture they will make you disbelievers after your belief.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:101: How can ye disbelieve, when it is ye unto whom Allah’s revelations are recited, and His messenger is in your midst ? He who holdeth fast to Allah, he indeed is guided unto a right path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:102: O ye who believe! Observe your duty to Allah with right observance, and die not save as those who have surrendered (unto Him)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:103: And hold fast, all of you together, to the cable of Allah, and do not separate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:104: And there may spring from you a nation who invite to goodness, and enjoin right conduct and forbid indecency.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:105: And be ye not as those who separated and disputed after the clear proofs had come unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:106: On the Day when (some) faces will be whitened and (some) faces will be blackened; and as for those whose faces have been blackened, it will be said unto them: Disbelieved ye after your (profession of) belief ? Then taste the punishment for that ye disbelieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:107: And as for those whose faces have been whitened, in the mercy of Allah they dwell for ever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:109: Unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth; and unto Allah all things are returned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:110: Ye are the best community that hath been raised up for mankind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:111: They will not harm you save a trifling hurt, and if they fight against you they will turn and flee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:112: Ignominy shall be their portion wheresoever they are found save (where they grasp) a rope from Allah and a rope from men.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:114: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and enjoin right conduct and forbid indecency, and vie one with another in good works.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:115: And whatever good they do, they will not be denied the meed thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:116: Lo! the riches and the progeny of those who disbelieve will not avail them aught against Allah; and such are rightful owners of the Fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:117: The likeness of that which they spend in this life of the world is as the likeness of a biting, icy wind which smiteth the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves, and devastateth it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:118: O ye who believe! Take not for intimates others than your own folk, who would spare no pains to ruin you; they love to hamper you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:119: Lo! ye are those who love them though they love you not, and ye believe in all the Scripture.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:120: If a lucky chance befall you, it is evil unto them, and if disaster strike you they rejoice thereat.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:121: And when thou settedst forth at daybreak from thy housefolk to assign to the believers their positions for the battle, Allah was Hearer, Knower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:122: When two parties of you almost fell away, and Allah was their Protecting Friend.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:123: Allah had already given you the victory at Badr, when ye were contemptible.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:124: When thou didst say unto the believers: Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should support you with three thousand angels sent down (to your help) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:125: Nay, but if ye persevere, and keep from evil, and (the enemy) attack you suddenly, your Lord will help you with five thousand angels sweeping on.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:126: Allah ordained this only as a message of good cheer for you, and that thereby your hearts might be at rest - Victory cometh only from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:127: That He may cut off a part of those who disbelieve, or overwhelm them so that they retire, frustrated.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:128: It is no concern at all of thee (Muhammad) whether He relent toward them or punish them; for they are evil-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:129: Unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:130: O ye who believe! Devour not usury, doubling and quadrupling (the sum lent).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:131: And ward off (from yourselves) the Fire prepared for disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:132: And obey Allah and the messenger, that ye may find mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:133: And vie one with another for forgiveness from your Lord, and for a paradise as wide as are the heavens and the earth, prepared for those who ward off (evil);
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:134: Those who spend (of that which Allah hath given them) in ease and in adversity, those who control their wrath and are forgiving toward mankind; Allah loveth the good;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:135: And those who, when they do an evil thing or wrong themselves, remember Allah and implore forgiveness for their sins - Who forgiveth sins save Allah only ? - and will not knowingly repeat (the wrong) they did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:136: The reward of such will be forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever - a bountiful reward for workers!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:137: Systems have passed away before you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:138: This is a declaration for mankind, a guidance and an admonition unto those who ward off (evil)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:139: Faint not nor grieve, for ye will overcome them if ye are (indeed) believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:140: If ye have received a blow, the (disbelieving) people have received a blow the like thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:141: And that Allah may prove those who believe, and may blight the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:142: Or deemed ye that ye would enter paradise while yet Allah knoweth not those of you who really strive, nor knoweth those (of you) who are steadfast ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:143: And verily ye used to wish for death before ye met it (in the field).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:144: Muhammad is but a messenger, messengers (the like of whom) have passed away before him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:145: No soul can ever die except by Allah’s leave and at a term appointed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:146: And with how many a prophet have there been a number of devoted men who fought (beside him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:147: Their cry was only that they said: Our Lord! forgive us for our sins and wasted efforts, make our foothold sure, and give us victory over the disbelieving folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:148: So Allah gave them the reward of the world and the good reward of the Hereafter.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:149: O ye who believe! if ye obey those who disbelieve, they will make you turn back on your heels, and ye turn back as losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:150: But Allah is your Protector, and He is the Best of Helpers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:151: We shall cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve because they ascribe unto Allah partners, for which no warrant hath been revealed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:152: Allah verily made good His promise unto you when ye routed them by His leave, until (the moment) when your courage failed you, and ye disagreed about the order and ye disobeyed, after He had shown you that for which ye long.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:153: When ye climbed (the hill) and paid no heed to anyone, while the messenger, in your rear, was calling you (to fight).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:154: Then, after grief, He sent down security for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:155: Lo! those of you who turned back on the day when the two hosts met, Satan alone it was who caused them to backslide, because of some of that which they have earned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:156: O ye who believe! Be not as those who disbelieved and said of their brethren who went abroad in the land or were fighting in the field: If they had been (here) with us they would not have died or been killed: that Allah may make it anguish in their hearts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:157: And what though ye be slain in Allah’s way or die therein ? Surely pardon from Allah and mercy are better than all that they amass.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:158: What though ye be slain or die, when unto Allah ye are gathered ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:159: It was by the mercy of Allah that thou wast lenient with them (O Muhammad), for if thou hadst been stern and fierce of heart they would have dispersed from round about thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:160: If Allah is your helper none can overcome you, and if He withdraw His help from you, who is there who can help you after Him ? In Allah let believers put their trust.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:161: It is not for any prophet to embezzle.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:162: Is one who followeth the pleasure of Allah as one who hath earned condemnation from Allah, whose habitation is the Fire, a hapless journey’s end ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:163: There are degrees (of grace and reprobation) with Allah, and Allah is Seer of what they do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:164: Allah verily hath shown grace to the believers by sending unto them a messenger of their own who reciteth unto them His revelations, and causeth them to grow, and teacheth them the Scripture and wisdom; although before (he came to them) they were in flagrant error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:165: And was it so, when a disaster smote you, though ye had smitten (them with a disaster) twice (as great), that ye said: How is this ? Say (unto them, O Muhammad): It is from yourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:166: That which befell you, on the day when the two armies met, was by permission of Allah; that He might know the true believers;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:167: And that He might know the hypocrites, unto whom it was said: Come, fight in the way of Allah, or defend yourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:168: Those who, while they sat at home, said of their brethren (who were fighting for the cause of Allah): If they had been guided by us they would not have been slain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:169: Think not of those, who are slain in the way of Allah, as dead.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:170: Jubilant (are they) because of that which Allah hath bestowed upon them of His bounty, rejoicing for the sake of those who have not joined them but are left behind: That there shall no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:171: They rejoice because of favour from Allah and kindness, and that Allah wasteth not the wage of the believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:172: As for those who heard the call of Allah and His messenger after the harm befell them (in the fight); for such of them as do right and ward off (evil), there is great reward.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:173: Those unto whom men said: Lo! the people have gathered against you, therefor fear them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:174: So they returned with grace and favour from Allah, and no harm touched them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:175: It is only the devil who would make (men) fear his partisans.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:176: Let not their conduct grieve thee, who run easily to disbelief, for lo! they injure Allah not at all.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:177: Those who purchase disbelief at the price of faith harm Allah not at all, but theirs will be a painful doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:178: And let not those who disbelieve imagine that the rein We give them bodeth good unto their souls.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:179: It is not (the purpose) of Allah to leave you in your present state till He shall separate the wicked from the good.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:180: And let not those who hoard up that which Allah hath bestowed upon them of His bounty think that it is better for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:181: Verily Allah heard the saying of those who said, (when asked for contributions to the war): "Allah, forsooth, is poor, and we are rich!" We shall record their saying with their slaying of the prophets wrongfully and We shall say: Taste ye the punishment of burning!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:182: This is on account of that which your own hands have sent before (you to the judgment).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:183: (The same are) those who say: Lo! Allah hath charged us that we believe not in any messenger until he bring us an offering which fire (from heaven) shall devour.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:184: And if they deny thee, even so did they deny messengers who were before thee, who came with miracles and with the Psalms and with the Scripture giving light.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:185: Every soul will taste of death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:186: Assuredly ye will be tried in your property and in your persons, and ye will hear much wrong from those who were given the Scripture before you, and from the idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:187: And (remember) when Allah laid a charge on those who had received the Scripture (He said): Ye are to expound it to mankind and not to hide it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:188: Think not that those who exult in what they have given, and love to be praised for what they have not done - Think not, they are in safety from the doom.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:189: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:190: Lo! In the creation of the heavens and the earth and (in) the difference of night and day are tokens (of His Sovereignty) for men of understanding,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:191: Such as remember Allah, standing, sitting, and reclining, and consider the creation of the heavens and the earth, (and say): Our Lord! Thou createdst not this in vain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:192: Our Lord! Whom Thou causest to enter the Fire: him indeed Thou hast confounded.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:193: Our Lord! Lo! we have heard a crier calling unto Faith: "Believe ye in your Lord!" So we believed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:194: Our Lord! And give us that which Thou hast promised to us by Thy messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:195: And their Lord hath heard them (and He saith): Lo! I suffer not the work of any worker, male or female, to be lost.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:196: Let not the vicissitude (of the success) of those who disbelieve, in the land, deceive thee (O Muhammad).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:197: It is but a brief comfort.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:198: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be safe for ever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:199: And lo! of the People of the Scripture there are some who believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto you and that which was revealed unto them, humbling themselves before Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 3:200: O ye who believe! Endure, outdo all others in endurance, be ready, and observe your duty to Allah, in order that ye may succeed.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:2: God! There is no god but He,-the Living, the Self-Subsisting, Eternal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:3: It is He Who sent down to thee (step by step), in truth, the Book, confirming what went before it; and He sent down the Law (of Moses) and the Gospel (of Jesus) before this, as a guide to mankind, and He sent down the criterion (of judgment between right and wrong).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:4: Then those who reject Faith in the Signs of God will suffer the severest penalty, and God is Exalted in Might, Lord of Retribution.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:5: From God, verily nothing is hidden on earth or in the heavens.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:6: He it is Who shapes you in the wombs as He pleases.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:7: He it is Who has sent down to thee the Book: In it are verses basic or fundamental (of established meaning); they are the foundation of the Book: others are allegorical.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:8: "Our Lord!" (they say), "Let not our hearts deviate now after Thou hast guided us, but grant us mercy from Thine own Presence; for Thou art the Grantor of bounties without measure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:9: "Our Lord! Thou art He that will gather mankind Together against a day about which there is no doubt; for God never fails in His promise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:10: Those who reject Faith,- neither their possessions nor their (numerous) progeny will avail them aught against God: They are themselves but fuel for the Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:11: (Their plight will be) no better than that of the people of Pharaoh, and their predecessors: They denied our Signs, and God called them to account for their sins.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:12: Say to those who reject Faith: "Soon will ye be vanquished and gathered together to Hell,-an evil bed indeed (to lie on)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:13: "There has already been for you a Sign in the two armies that met (in combat): One was fighting in the cause of God, the other resisting God; these saw with their own eyes Twice their number.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:14: Fair in the eyes of men is the love of things they covet: Women and sons; Heaped-up hoards of gold and silver; horses branded (for blood and excellence); and (wealth of) cattle and well-tilled land.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:15: Say: Shall I give you glad tidings of things Far better than those? For the righteous are Gardens in nearness to their Lord, with rivers flowing beneath; therein is their eternal home; with companions pure (and holy); and the good pleasure of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:16: (Namely), those who say: "Our Lord! we have indeed believed: forgive us, then, our sins, and save us from the agony of the Fire;"-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:17: Those who show patience, Firmness and self-control; who are true (in word and deed); who worship devoutly; who spend (in the way of God); and who pray for forgiveness in the early hours of the morning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:18: There is no god but He: That is the witness of God, His angels, and those endued with knowledge, standing firm on justice.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:19: The Religion before God is Islam (submission to His Will): Nor did the People of the Book dissent therefrom except through envy of each other, after knowledge had come to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:20: So if they dispute with thee, say: "I have submitted My whole self to God and so have those who follow me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:21: As to those who deny the Signs of God and in defiance of right, slay the prophets, and slay those who teach just dealing with mankind, announce to them a grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:22: They are those whose works will bear no fruit in this world and in the Hereafter nor will they have anyone to help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:23: Hast thou not turned Thy vision to those who have been given a portion of the Book? They are invited to the Book of God, to settle their dispute, but a party of them Turn back and decline (The arbitration).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:24: This because they say: "The Fire shall not touch us but for a few numbered days": For their forgeries deceive them as to their own religion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:25: But how (will they fare) when we gather them together against a day about which there is no doubt, and each soul will be paid out just what it has earned, without (favour or) injustice?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:26: Say: "O God! Lord of Power (And Rule), Thou givest power to whom Thou pleasest, and Thou strippest off power from whom Thou pleasest: Thou enduest with honour whom Thou pleasest, and Thou bringest low whom Thou pleasest: In Thy hand is all good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:27: "Thou causest the night to gain on the day, and thou causest the day to gain on the night; Thou bringest the Living out of the dead, and Thou bringest the dead out of the Living; and Thou givest sustenance to whom Thou pleasest, without measure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:28: Let not the believers Take for friends or helpers Unbelievers rather than believers: if any do that, in nothing will there be help from God: except by way of precaution, that ye may Guard yourselves from them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:29: Say: "Whether ye hide what is in your hearts or reveal it, God knows it all: He knows what is in the heavens, and what is on earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:30: "On the Day when every soul will be confronted with all the good it has done, and all the evil it has done, it will wish there were a great distance between it and its evil.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:31: Say: "If ye do love God, Follow me: God will love you and forgive you your sins: For God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:32: Say: "Obey God and His Apostle": But if they turn back, God loveth not those who reject Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:33: God did choose Adam and Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of ’Imran above all people,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:34: Offspring, one of the other: And God heareth and knoweth all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:35: Behold! a woman of ’Imran said: "O my Lord! I do dedicate unto Thee what is in my womb for Thy special service: So accept this of me: For Thou hearest and knowest all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:36: When she was delivered, she said: "O my Lord! Behold! I am delivered of a female child!"- and God knew best what she brought forth- "And no wise is the male Like the female.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:37: Right graciously did her Lord accept her: He made her grow in purity and beauty: To the care of Zakariya was she assigned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:38: There did Zakariya pray to his Lord, saying: "O my Lord! Grant unto me from Thee a progeny that is pure: for Thou art He that heareth prayer!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:39: While he was standing in prayer in the chamber, the angels called unto him: "God doth give thee glad tidings of Yahya, witnessing the truth of a Word from God, and (be besides) noble, chaste, and a prophet,- of the (goodly) company of the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:40: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have son, seeing I am very old, and my wife is barren?" "Thus," was the answer, "Doth God accomplish what He willeth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:41: He said: "O my Lord! Give me a Sign!" "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three days but with signals.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:42: Behold! the angels said: "O Mary! God hath chosen thee and purified thee- chosen thee above the women of all nations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:43: "O Mary! worship Thy Lord devoutly: Prostrate thyself, and bow down (in prayer) with those who bow down.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:44: This is part of the tidings of the things unseen, which We reveal unto thee (O Apostle!) by inspiration: Thou wast not with them when they cast lots with arrows, as to which of them should be charged with the care of Mary: Nor wast thou with them when they disputed (the point).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:45: Behold! the angels said: "O Mary! God giveth thee glad tidings of a Word from Him: his name will be Christ Jesus, the son of Mary, held in honour in this world and the Hereafter and of (the company of) those nearest to God;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:46: "He shall speak to the people in childhood and in maturity.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:47: She said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man hath touched me?" He said: "Even so: God createth what He willeth: When He hath decreed a plan, He but saith to it, ’Be,’ and it is!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:48: "And God will teach him the Book and Wisdom, the Law and the Gospel,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:49: "And (appoint him) an apostle to the Children of Israel, (with this message): "’I have come to you, with a Sign from your Lord, in that I make for you out of clay, as it were, the figure of a bird, and breathe into it, and it becomes a bird by God’s leave: And I heal those born blind, and the lepers, and I quicken the dead, by God’s leave; and I declare to you what ye eat, and what ye store in your houses.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:50: "’(I have come to you), to attest the Law which was before me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:51: "’It is God Who is my Lord and your Lord; then worship Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:52: When Jesus found Unbelief on their part He said: "Who will be My helpers to (the work of) God?" Said the disciples: "We are God’s helpers: We believe in God, and do thou bear witness that we are Muslims.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:53: "Our Lord! we believe in what Thou hast revealed, and we follow the Apostle; then write us down among those who bear witness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:54: And (the unbelievers) plotted and planned, and God too planned, and the best of planners is God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:55: Behold! God said: "O Jesus! I will take thee and raise thee to Myself and clear thee (of the falsehoods) of those who blaspheme; I will make those who follow thee superior to those who reject faith, to the Day of Resurrection: Then shall ye all return unto me, and I will judge between you of the matters wherein ye dispute.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:56: "As to those who reject faith, I will punish them with terrible agony in this world and in the Hereafter, nor will they have anyone to help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:57: "As to those who believe and work righteousness, God will pay them (in full) their reward; but God loveth not those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:58: "This is what we rehearse unto thee of the Signs and the Message of Wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:59: The similitude of Jesus before God is as that of Adam; He created him from dust, then said to him: "Be".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:60: The Truth (comes) from God alone; so be not of those who doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:61: If any one disputes in this matter with thee, now after (full) knowledge Hath come to thee, say: "Come! let us gather together,- our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves: Then let us earnestly pray, and invoke the curse of God on those who lie!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:62: This is the true account: There is no god except God; and God-He is indeed the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:63: But if they turn back, God hath full knowledge of those who do mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:64: Say: "O People of the Book! come to common terms as between us and you: That we worship none but God; that we associate no partners with him; that we erect not, from among ourselves, Lords and patrons other than God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:65: Ye People of the Book! Why dispute ye about Abraham, when the Law and the Gospel Were not revealed Till after him? Have ye no understanding?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:66: Ah! Ye are those who fell to disputing (Even) in matters of which ye had some knowledge! but why dispute ye in matters of which ye have no knowledge? It is God Who knows, and ye who know not!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:67: Abraham was not a Jew nor yet a Christian; but he was true in Faith, and bowed his will to God’s (Which is Islam), and he joined not gods with God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:68: Without doubt, among men, the nearest of kin to Abraham, are those who follow him, as are also this Apostle and those who believe: And God is the Protector of those who have faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:69: It is the wish of a section of the People of the Book to lead you astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:70: Ye People of the Book! Why reject ye the Signs of God, of which ye are (Yourselves) witnesses?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:71: Ye People of the Book! Why do ye clothe Truth with falsehood, and conceal the Truth, while ye have knowledge?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:72: A section of the People of the Book say: "Believe in the morning what is revealed to the believers, but reject it at the end of the day; perchance they may (themselves) Turn back;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:73: "And believe no one unless he follows your religion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:74: For His Mercy He specially chooseth whom He pleaseth; for God is the Lord of bounties unbounded.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:75: Among the People of the Book are some who, if entrusted with a hoard of gold, will (readily) pay it back; others, who, if entrusted with a single silver coin, will not repay it unless thou constantly stoodest demanding, because, they say, "there is no call on us (to keep faith) with these ignorant (Pagans).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:77: As for those who sell the faith they owe to God and their own plighted word for a small price, they shall have no portion in the Hereafter: Nor will God (Deign to) speak to them or look at them on the Day of Judgment, nor will He cleans them (of sin): They shall have a grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:78: There is among them a section who distort the Book with their tongues: (As they read) you would think it is a part of the Book, but it is no part of the Book; and they say, "That is from God," but it is not from God: It is they who tell a lie against God, and (well) they know it!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:79: It is not (possible) that a man, to whom is given the Book, and Wisdom, and the prophetic office, should say to people: "Be ye my worshippers rather than God’s": on the contrary (He would say) "Be ye worshippers of Him Who is truly the Cherisher of all: For ye have taught the Book and ye have studied it earnestly.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:80: Nor would he instruct you to take angels and prophets for Lords and patrons.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:81: Behold! God took the covenant of the prophets, saying: "I give you a Book and Wisdom; then comes to you an apostle, confirming what is with you; do ye believe in him and render him help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:82: If any turn back after this, they are perverted transgressors.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:83: Do they seek for other than the Religion of God?-while all creatures in the heavens and on earth have, willing or unwilling, bowed to His Will (Accepted Islam), and to Him shall they all be brought back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:84: Say: "We believe in God, and in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Isma’il, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, and in (the Books) given to Moses, Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord: We make no distinction between one and another among them, and to God do we bow our will (in Islam).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:85: If anyone desires a religion other than Islam (submission to God), never will it be accepted of him; and in the Hereafter He will be in the ranks of those who have lost (All spiritual good).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:86: How shall God Guide those who reject Faith after they accepted it and bore witness that the Apostle was true and that Clear Signs had come unto them? but God guides not a people unjust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:87: Of such the reward is that on them (rests) the curse of God, of His angels, and of all mankind;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:88: In that will they dwell; nor will their penalty be lightened, nor respite be (their lot);-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:89: Except for those that repent (Even) after that, and make amends; for verily God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:90: But those who reject Faith after they accepted it, and then go on adding to their defiance of Faith,- never will their repentance be accepted; for they are those who have (of set purpose) gone astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:91: As to those who reject Faith, and die rejecting,- never would be accepted from any such as much gold as the earth contains, though they should offer it for ransom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:92: By no means shall ye attain righteousness unless ye give (freely) of that which ye love; and whatever ye give, of a truth God knoweth it well.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:93: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel Made unlawful for itself, before the Law (of Moses) was revealed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:94: If any, after this, invent a lie and attribute it to God, they are indeed unjust wrong-doers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:95: Say: "God speaketh the Truth: follow the religion of Abraham, the sane in faith; he was not of the Pagans.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:96: The first House (of worship) appointed for men was that at Bakka: Full of blessing and of guidance for all kinds of beings:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:97: In it are Signs Manifest; (for example), the Station of Abraham; whoever enters it attains security; Pilgrimage thereto is a duty men owe to God,- those who can afford the journey; but if any deny faith, God stands not in need of any of His creatures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:98: Say: "O People of the Book! Why reject ye the Signs of God, when God is Himself witness to all ye do?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:99: Say: "O ye People of the Book! Why obstruct ye those who believe, from the path of God, Seeking to make it crooked, while ye were yourselves witnesses (to God’s Covenant)? but God is not unmindful of all that ye do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:100: O ye who believe! If ye listen to a faction among the People of the Book, they would (indeed) render you apostates after ye have believed!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:101: And how would ye deny Faith while unto you are rehearsed the Signs of God, and among you Lives the Apostle? Whoever holds firmly to God will be shown a way that is straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:102: O ye who believe! Fear God as He should be feared, and die not except in a state of Islam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:103: And hold fast, all together, by the rope which God (stretches out for you), and be not divided among yourselves; and remember with gratitude God’s favour on you; for ye were enemies and He joined your hearts in love, so that by His Grace, ye became brethren; and ye were on the brink of the pit of Fire, and He saved you from it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:104: Let there arise out of you a band of people inviting to all that is good, enjoining what is right, and forbidding what is wrong: They are the ones to attain felicity.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:105: Be not like those who are divided amongst themselves and fall into disputations after receiving Clear Signs: For them is a dreadful penalty,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:106: On the Day when some faces will be (lit up with) white, and some faces will be (in the gloom of) black: To those whose faces will be black, (will be said): "Did ye reject Faith after accepting it? Taste then the penalty for rejecting Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:107: But those whose faces will be (lit with) white,- they will be in (the light of) God’s mercy: therein to dwell (for ever).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:108: These are the Signs of God: We rehearse them to thee in Truth: And God means no injustice to any of His creatures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:109: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: To Him do all questions go back (for decision).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:110: Ye are the best of peoples, evolved for mankind, enjoining what is right, forbidding what is wrong, and believing in God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:111: They will do you no harm, barring a trifling annoyance; if they come out to fight you, they will show you their backs, and no help shall they get.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:112: Shame is pitched over them (Like a tent) wherever they are found, except when under a covenant (of protection) from God and from men; they draw on themselves wrath from God, and pitched over them is (the tent of) destitution.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:113: Not all of them are alike: Of the People of the Book are a portion that stand (For the right): They rehearse the Signs of God all night long, and they prostrate themselves in adoration.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:114: They believe in God and the Last Day; they enjoin what is right, and forbid what is wrong; and they hasten (in emulation) in (all) good works: They are in the ranks of the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:115: Of the good that they do, nothing will be rejected of them; for God knoweth well those that do right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:116: Those who reject Faith,- neither their possessions nor their (numerous) progeny will avail them aught against God: They will be companions of the Fire,-dwelling therein (for ever).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:117: What they spend in the life of this (material) world May be likened to a wind which brings a nipping frost: It strikes and destroys the harvest of men who have wronged their own souls: it is not God that hath wronged them, but they wrong themselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:118: O ye who believe! Take not into your intimacy those outside your ranks: They will not fail to corrupt you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:119: Ah! ye are those who love them, but they love you not,- though ye believe in the whole of the Book.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:120: If aught that is good befalls you, it grieves them; but if some misfortune overtakes you, they rejoice at it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:121: Remember that morning Thou didst leave Thy household (early) to post the faithful at their stations for battle: And God heareth and knoweth all things:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:122: Remember two of your parties Meditated cowardice; but God was their protector, and in God should the faithful (Ever) put their trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:123: God had helped you at Badr, when ye were a contemptible little force; then fear God; thus May ye show your gratitude.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:124: Remember thou saidst to the Faithful: "Is it not enough for you that God should help you with three thousand angels (Specially) sent down?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:125: "Yea, - if ye remain firm, and act aright, even if the enemy should rush here on you in hot haste, your Lord would help you with five thousand angels Making a terrific onslaught.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:126: God made it but a message of hope for you, and an assurance to your hearts: (in any case) there is no help except from God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:127: That He might cut off a fringe of the Unbelievers or expose them to infamy, and they should then be turned back, frustrated of their purpose.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:128: Not for thee, (but for God), is the decision: Whether He turn in mercy to them, or punish them; for they are indeed wrong-doers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:129: To God belongeth all that is in the heavens and on earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:130: O ye who believe! Devour not usury, doubled and multiplied; but fear God; that ye may (really) prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:131: Fear the Fire, which is repaired for those who reject Faith:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:132: And obey God and the Apostle; that ye may obtain mercy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:133: Be quick in the race for forgiveness from your Lord, and for a Garden whose width is that (of the whole) of the heavens and of the earth, prepared for the righteous,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:134: Those who spend (freely), whether in prosperity, or in adversity; who restrain anger, and pardon (all) men;- for God loves those who do good;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:135: And those who, having done something to be ashamed of, or wronged their own souls, earnestly bring God to mind, and ask for forgiveness for their sins,- and who can forgive sins except God?- and are never obstinate in persisting knowingly in (the wrong) they have done.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:136: For such the reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens with rivers flowing underneath,- an eternal dwelling: How excellent a recompense for those who work (and strive)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:137: Many were the Ways of Life that have passed away before you: travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those who rejected Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:138: Here is a plain statement to men, a guidance and instruction to those who fear God!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:139: So lose not heart, nor fall into despair: For ye must gain mastery if ye are true in Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:140: If a wound hath touched you, be sure a similar wound hath touched the others.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:141: God’s object also is to purge those that are true in Faith and to deprive of blessing Those that resist Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:142: Did ye think that ye would enter Heaven without God testing those of you who fought hard (In His Cause) and remained steadfast?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:143: Ye did indeed wish for death before ye met him: Now ye have seen him with your own eyes, (And ye flinch!)
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:144: Muhammad is no more than an apostle: many Were the apostle that passed away before him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:145: Nor can a soul die except by God’s leave, the term being fixed as by writing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:146: How many of the prophets fought (in God’s way), and with them (fought) Large bands of godly men? but they never lost heart if they met with disaster in God’s way, nor did they weaken (in will) nor give in.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:147: All that they said was: "Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and anything We may have done that transgressed our duty: Establish our feet firmly, and help us against those that resist Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:148: And God gave them a reward in this world, and the excellent reward of the Hereafter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:149: O ye who believe! If ye obey the Unbelievers, they will drive you back on your heels, and ye will turn back (from Faith) to your own loss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:150: Nay, God is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:151: Soon shall We cast terror into the hearts of the Unbelievers, for that they joined companions with God, for which He had sent no authority: their abode will be the Fire: And evil is the home of the wrong-doers!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:152: God did indeed fulfil His promise to you when ye with His permission Were about to annihilate your enemy,-until ye flinched and fell to disputing about the order, and disobeyed it after He brought you in sight (of the booty) which ye covet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:153: Behold! ye were climbing up the high ground, without even casting a side glance at any one, and the Apostle in your rear was calling you back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:154: After (the excitement) of the distress, He sent down calm on a band of you overcome with slumber, while another band was stirred to anxiety by their own feelings, Moved by wrong suspicions of God-suspicions due to ignorance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:155: Those of you who turned back on the day the two hosts Met,-it was Satan who caused them to fail, because of some (evil) they had done.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:156: O ye who believe! Be not like the Unbelievers, who say of their brethren, when they are travelling through the Earth or engaged in fighting: "If they had stayed with us, they would not have died, or been slain.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:157: And if ye are slain, or die, in the way of God, forgiveness and mercy from God are far better than all they could amass.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:158: And if ye die, or are slain, Lo! it is unto God that ye are brought together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:159: It is part of the Mercy of God that thou dost deal gently with them Wert thou severe or harsh-hearted, they would have broken away from about thee: so pass over (Their faults), and ask for (God’s) forgiveness for them; and consult them in affairs (of moment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:160: If God helps you, none can overcome you: If He forsakes you, who is there, after that, that can help you? in God, then, Let believers put their trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:161: No prophet could (ever) be false to his trust.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:162: Is the man who follows the good pleasure of God Like the man who draws on himself the wrath of God, and whose abode is in Hell?- A woeful refuge!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:163: They are in varying gardens in the sight of God, and God sees well all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:164: God did confer a great favour on the believers when He sent among them an apostle from among themselves, rehearsing unto them the Signs of God, sanctifying them, and instructing them in Scripture and Wisdom, while, before that, they had been in manifest error.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:165: What! When a single disaster smites you, although ye smote (your enemies) with one twice as great, do ye say?- "Whence is this?" Say (to them): "It is from yourselves: For God hath power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:166: What ye suffered on the day the two armies Met, was with the leave of God, in order that He might test the believers,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:168: (They are) the ones that say, (of their brethren slain), while they themselves sit (at ease): "If only they had listened to us they would not have been slain.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:169: Think not of those who are slain in God’s way as dead.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:170: They rejoice in the bounty provided by God: And with regard to those left behind, who have not yet joined them (in their bliss), the (Martyrs) glory in the fact that on them is no fear, nor have they (cause to) grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:171: They glory in the Grace and the bounty from God, and in the fact that God suffereth not the reward of the Faithful to be lost (in the least).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:172: Of those who answered the call of God and the Apostle, even after being wounded, those who do right and refrain from wrong have a great reward;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:173: Men said to them: "A great army is gathering against you": And frightened them: But it (only) increased their Faith: They said: "For us God sufficeth, and He is the best disposer of affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:174: And they returned with Grace and bounty from God: no harm ever touched them: For they followed the good pleasure of God: And God is the Lord of bounties unbounded.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:175: It is only the Evil One that suggests to you the fear of his votaries: Be ye not afraid of them, but fear Me, if ye have Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:176: Let not those grieve thee who rush headlong into Unbelief: Not the least harm will they do to God: God’s plan is that He will give them no portion in the Hereafter, but a severe punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:177: Those who purchase Unbelief at the price of faith,- not the least harm will they do to God, but they will have a grievous punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:178: Let not the Unbelievers think that our respite to them is good for themselves: We grant them respite that they may grow in their iniquity: But they will have a shameful punishment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:179: God will not leave the believers in the state in which ye are now, until He separates what is evil from what is good nor will He disclose to you the secrets of the Unseen.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:180: And let not those who covetously withhold of the gifts which God Hath given them of His Grace, think that it is good for them: Nay, it will be the worse for them: soon shall the things which they covetously withheld be tied to their necks Like a twisted collar, on the Day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:181: God hath heard the taunt of those who say: "Truly, God is indigent and we are rich!"- We shall certainly record their word and (their act) of slaying the prophets in defiance of right, and We shall say: "Taste ye the penalty of the Scorching Fire!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:182: "This is because of the (unrighteous deeds) which your hands sent on before ye: For God never harms those who serve Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:183: They (also) said: "God took our promise not to believe in an apostle unless He showed us a sacrifice consumed by Fire (From heaven).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:184: Then if they reject thee, so were rejected apostles before thee, who came with Clear Signs, Books of dark prophecies, and the Book of Enlightenment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:185: Every soul shall have a taste of death: And only on the Day of Judgment shall you be paid your full recompense.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:186: Ye shall certainly be tried and tested in your possessions and in your personal selves; and ye shall certainly Hear much that will grieve you, from those who received the Book before you and from those who worship many gods.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:187: And remember God took a covenant from the People of the Book, to make it known and clear to mankind, and not to hide it; but they threw it away behind their backs, and purchased with it some miserable gain! And vile was the bargain they made!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:188: Think not that those who exult in what they have brought about, and love to be praised for what they have not done,- think escape the penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:189: To God belongeth the dominion of the heavens and the earth; and God hath power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:190: Behold! in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of night and day,- there are indeed Signs for men of understanding,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:191: Men who celebrate the praises of God, standing, sitting, and lying down on their sides, and contemplate the (wonders of) creation in the heavens and the earth, (With the thought): "Our Lord! not for naught Hast Thou created (all) this! Glory to Thee! Give us salvation from the penalty of the Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:192: "Our Lord! any whom Thou dost admit to the Fire, Truly Thou coverest with shame, and never will wrong-doers Find any helpers!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:193: "Our Lord! we have heard the call of one calling (Us) to Faith, ’Believe ye in the Lord,’ and we have believed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:194: "Our Lord! Grant us what Thou didst promise unto us through Thine apostles, and save us from shame on the Day of Judgment: For Thou never breakest Thy promise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:195: And their Lord hath accepted of them, and answered them: "Never will I suffer to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female: Ye are members, one of another: Those who have left their homes, or been driven out therefrom, or suffered harm in My Cause, or fought or been slain,- verily, I will blot out from them their iniquities, and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath;- A reward from the presence of God, and from His presence is the best of rewards.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:196: Let not the strutting about of the Unbelievers through the land deceive thee:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:197: Little is it for enjoyment: Their ultimate abode is Hell: what an evil bed (To lie on)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:198: On the other hand, for those who fear their Lord, are Gardens, with rivers flowing beneath; therein are they to dwell (for ever),- a gift from the presence of God; and that which is in the presence of God is the best (bliss) for the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:199: And there are, certainly, among the People of the Book, those who believe in God, in the revelation to you, and in the revelation to them, bowing in humility to God: They will not sell the Signs of God for a miserable gain! For them is a reward with their Lord, and God is swift in account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 3:200: O ye who believe! Persevere in patience and constancy; vie in such perseverance; strengthen each other; and fear God; that ye may prosper.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:2: God, there is no god but He, the Living, the Everlasting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:3: He has sent down upon thee the Book with the truth, confirming what was before it, and He sent down the Torah and the Gospel
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:4: aforetime, as guidance to the people, and He sent down the Salvation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:5: From God nothing whatever is hidden in heaven and earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:6: It is He who forms you in the womb as He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:7: It is He who sent down upon thee the Book, wherein are verses clear that are the Essence of the Book, and others ambiguous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:8: Our Lord, make not our hearts to swerve after that Thou hast guided us; and give us mercy from Thee; Thou art the Giver.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:9: Our Lord, it is Thou that shall gather mankind for a day whereon is no doubt; verily God will not fail the tryst.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:10: As for the unbelievers, their riches will not avail them, neither their children, aught against God; those -- they shall be fuel for the Fire
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:11: like Pharaoh’s folk, and the people before them, who cried lies to Our signs; God seized them because of their sins; God is terrible in retribution.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:12: Say to the unbelievers: ’You shall be overthrown, and mustered into Gehenna -- an evil cradling!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:13: There has already been a sign for you in the two companies that encountered, one company fighting in the way of God and another unbelieving; they saw them twice the like of them, as the eye sees, but God confirms with His help whom He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:14: Decked out fair to men is the love of lusts -- women, children, heaped-up heaps of gold and silver, horses of mark, cattle and tillage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:15: Say: ’Shall I tell you of a better than that?’ For those that are godfearing, with their Lord are gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever, and spouses purified, and God’s good pleasure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:16: who say, ’Our Lord, we believe; forgive us our sins, and guard us against the chastisement of the Fire’ --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:17: men who are patient, truthful, obedient, expenders in alms, imploring God’s pardon at the daybreak.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:18: God bears witness that there is no god but He -- and the angels, and men possessed of knowledge -- upholding justice; there is no god but He, the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:19: The true religion with God is Islam.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:20: So if they dispute with thee, say: ’I have surrendered my will to God, and whosoever follows me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:21: Those who disbelieve in the signs of God and slay the Prophets without right, and slay such men as bid to justice -- do thou give them the good tidings of a painful chastisement;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:22: their works have failed in this world and the next; they have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:23: Hast thou not regarded those who were given a portion of the Book, being called to the Book of God, that it might decide between them, and then a party of them turned away, swerving aside?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:24: That, because they said, ’The Fire shall not touch us, except for a number of days’; and the lies they forged has deluded them in their religion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:25: But how will it be, when We gather them for a day whereon is no doubt, and every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:26: Say: ’O God, Master of the Kingdom, Thou givest the Kingdom to whom Thou wilt, and seizest the Kingdom from whom Thou wilt, Thou exaltest whom Thou wilt, and Thou abasest whom Thou wilt; in Thy hand is the good; Thou art powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:27: Thou makest the night to enter into the day and Thou makest the day to enter into the night, Thou bringest forth the living from the dead and Thou bringest forth the dead from the living, and Thou providest whomsoever Thou wilt without reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:28: Let not the believers take the unbelievers for friends, rather than the believers -- for whoso does that belongs not to God in anything -- unless you have a fear of them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:29: Say: ’Whether you hide what is in your breasts or publish it, God knows it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:30: The day every soul shall find what it has done of good brought forward, and what it has done of evil; it will wish if there were only a far space between it and that day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:31: Say: ’If you love God, follow me, and God will love you, and forgive you your sins; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:33: God chose Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all beings, the
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:34: seed of one another; God hears, and knows.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:35: When the wife of Imran said, ’Lord, I have vowed to Thee, in dedication, what is within my womb.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:36: And when she gave birth to her she said, ’Lord, I have given birth to her, a female.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:37: Her Lord received the child with gracious favour, and by His goodness she grew up comely, Zachariah taking charge of her.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:38: Then Zachariah prayed to his Lord saying, ’Lord, give me of Thy goodness a goodly offspring.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:39: And the angels called to him, standing in the Sanctuary at worship, ’Lo, God gives thee good tidings of John, who shall confirm a Word of God, a chief, and chaste, a Prophet, righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:40: ’Lord,’ said Zachariah, ’how shall I have a son, seeing I am an old man and my wife is barren?’ ’Even so,’ God said, ’God does what He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:41: ’Lord,’ said Zachariah, ’appoint to me a sign.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:42: And when the angels said, ’Mary, God has chosen thee, and purified thee; He has chosen thee above all women.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:43: Mary; be obedient to thy Lord, prostrating and bowing before Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:44: (That is of the tidings of the Unseen, that We reveal to thee; for thou wast not with them, when they were casting quills which of them should have charge of Mary; thou wast not with them, when they were disputing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:45: When the angels said, ’Mary, God gives thee good tidings of a Word from Him whose name is Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary; high honoured shall he be in this world and the next, near stationed to God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:46: He shall speak to men in the cradle, and of age, and righteous he shall be.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:47: He shall speak to men in the cradle, and of age, and righteous he shall be.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:48: And He will teach him the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah, the Gospel,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:49: to be a Messenger to the Children of Israel saying, "I have come to you with a sign from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:50: Likewise confirming the truth of the Torah that is before me, and to make lawful to you certain things that before were forbidden unto you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:51: Surely God is my Lord and your Lord; so serve Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:52: And when Jesus perceived their unbelief, he said, ’Who will be my helpers unto God?’ The Apostles said, ’We will be helpers of God; we believe in God; witness thou our submission.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:53: Lord, we believe in that Thou hast sent down, and we follow the Messenger.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:54: And they devised, and God devised, and God is the best of devisers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:55: When God said, ’Jesus, I will take thee to Me and will raise thee to Me and I will purify thee of those who believe not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:56: As for the unbelievers, I will chastise them with a terrible chastisement in this world and the next; they shall have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:57: But as for the believers, who do deeds of righteousness, He will pay them in full their wages: and God loves not the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:58: This We recite to thee of signs and wise remembrance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:59: Truly, the likeness of Jesus, in God’s sight, is as Adam’s likeness; He created him of dust, then said He unto him, ’Be,’ and he was.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:60: The truth is of God; be not of the doubters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:61: And whoso disputes with thee concerning him, after the knowledge that has come to thee, say: ’Come now, let us call our sons and your sons, our wives and your wives, our selves and your selves, then let us humbly pray and so lay God’s curse upon the ones who lie.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:63: And if they turn their backs, assuredly God knows the workers of corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:64: Say: ’People of the Book! Come now to a word common between us and you, that we serve none but God, and that we associate not aught with Him, and do not some of us take others as Lords, apart from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:65: People of the Book! Why do you dispute concerning Abraham? The Torah was not sent down, neither the Gospel, but after him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:66: Ha, you are the ones who dispute on what you know; why then dispute you touching a matter of which you know not anything? God knows, and you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:67: No; Abraham in truth was not a Jew, neither a Christian; but he was a Muslim and one pure of faith; certainly he was never of the idolaters
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:68: Surely the people standing closest to Abraham are those who followed him, and this Prophet, and those who believe; and God is the Protector of the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:69: There is a party of the People of the Book yearn to make you go astray; yet none they make to stray, except themselves, but they are not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:70: People of the Book! Why do you disbelieve in God’s signs, which you yourselves witness?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:71: People of the Book! Why do you confound the truth with vanity, and conceal the truth and that wittingly?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:72: There is a party of the People of the Book say, ’Believe in what has been sent down upon those who believe at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it; haply they will then return;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:73: and believe not any but him who follows your religion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:74: He singles out for His mercy whom He will; God is of bounty abounding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:75: And of the People of the Book is he who, if thou trust him with a hundredweight, will restore it thee; and of them is he who, if thou trust him with one pound, will not restore it thee, unless ever thou standest over him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:76: Nay, but whoso fulfils his covenant and fears God, God loves the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:77: Those that sell God’s covenant, and their oaths, for a little price, there shall be no share for them in the world to come; God shall not speak to them neither look on them on the Resurrection Day, neither will He purify them; and for them awaits a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:78: And there is a sect of them twist their tongues with the Book, that you may suppose it part of the Book, yet it is not part of the Book; and they say, ’It is from God,’ yet it is not from God, and they speak falsehood against God, and that wittingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:79: It belongs not to any mortal that God should give him the Book, the Judgment, the Prophethood, then he should say to men, ’Be you servants to me apart from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:80: He would never order you to take the angels and the Prophets as Lords; what, would He order you to disbelieve, after you have surrendered?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:81: And when God took compact with the Prophets: ’That I have given you of Book and Wisdom; then there shall come to you a Messenger confirming what is with you -- you shall believe in him and you shall help him; do you agree?’ He said.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:82: Then whosoever turns his back after that -- they are the ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:83: What, do they desire another religion than God’s, and to Him has surrendered whoso is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they shall be returned?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:84: Say: ’We believe in God, and that which has been sent down on us, and sent down on Abraham and Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes, and in that which was given to Moses and Jesus, and the Prophets, of their Lord; we make no division between any of them, and to Him we surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:85: Whoso desires another religion than Islam, it shall not be accepted of him; in the next world he shall be among the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:86: How shall God guide a people who have disbelieved after they believed, and bore witness that the Messenger is true, and the clear signs came to them? God guides not the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:87: Those -- their recompense is that there shall rest on them the curse of God and of the angels and of men, altogether,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:88: therein dwelling forever; the chastisement shall not be lightened for them; no respite shall be given them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:89: But those who repent thereafter, and make amends -- God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:90: Surely those who disbelieve after they have believed and then increase in unbelief -- their repentance shall not be accepted; those are the ones who stray.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:91: Surely those who disbelieve, and die disbelieving, there shall not be accepted from any one of them the whole earth full of gold, if he would ransom himself thereby; for them awaits a painful chastisement, and they shall have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:92: You will not attain piety until you expend of what you love; and whatever thing you expend, God knows of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:93: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel save what Israel forbade for himself before the Torah was sent down.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:94: Whoso forges falsehood against God after that, those are the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:95: Say: ’God has spoken the truth; therefore follow the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith and no idolater.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:96: The first House established for the people was that at Bekka, a place holy, and a guidance to all beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:97: Therein are clear signs -- the station of Abraham, and whosoever enters it is in security.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:98: Say: ’People of the Book, why do you disbelieve in the signs of God? Surely God is witness of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:99: Say: ’People of the Book, why do you bar from God’s way the believer, desiring to make it crooked, yourselves being witnesses? God is not heedless of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:100: O believers, if you obey a sect of those who have been given the Book, they will turn you, after you have believed, into unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:101: How can you disbelieve, seeing you have God’s signs recited to you, and His Messenger among you? Whosoever holds fast to God, he is guided to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:102: O believers, fear God as He should be feared, and see you do not die, save in surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:103: And hold you fast to God’s bond, together, and do not scatter; remember God’s blessing upon you when you were enemies, and He brought your hearts together, so that by His blessing you became brothers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:104: Let there be one nation of you, calling to good, and bidding to honour, and forbidding dishonour; those are the prosperers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:105: Be not as those who scattered and fell into variance after the clear signs came to them; those there awaits a mighty chastisement,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:106: the day when some faces are blackened, and some faces whitened.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:107: But as for those whose faces are whitened, they shall be in God’s mercy, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:108: These are the signs of God We recite to thee in truth, and God desires not any injustice to living beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:109: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth, and unto Him all matters are returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:110: You are the best nation ever brought forth to men, bidding to honour, and forbidding dishonour, and believing in God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:111: They will not harm you, except a little hurt; and if they fight with you, they will turn on you their backs; then they will not be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:112: Abasement shall be pitched on them, wherever they are come upon, except they be in a bond of God, and a bond of the people; they will be laden with the burden of God’s anger, and poverty shall be pitched on them; that, because they disbelieved in God’s signs, and slew the Prophets without right; that, for that they acted rebelliously and were transgressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:113: Yet they are not all alike; some of the People of the Book are a nation upstanding, that recite God’s signs in the watches of the night, bowing themselves,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:114: believing in God and in the Last Day, bidding to honour and forbidding dishonour, vying one with the other in good works; those are of the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:115: And whatsoever good you do, you shall not be denied the just reward of it; and God knows the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:116: As for the unbelievers, their riches shall not avail them, neither their children, against God; those are the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:117: The likeness of that they expend in this present life is as the likeness of a freezing blast that smites the tillage of a people who wronged themselves, and it destroyed that; God wronged them not, but themselves they wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:118: O believers, take not for your intimates outside yourselves such men spare nothing to ruin you; they yearn for you to suffer Hatred has already shown itself of their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is yet greater.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:119: Ha, there you are; you love them, and they love you not; you believe in the Book, all of it, and when they meet you they say, ’We believe,’ but when they go privily, they bite at you their fingers, enraged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:120: If you are visited by good fortune, it vexes them; but if you are smitten by evil, they rejoice at it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:121: When thou wentest forth at dawn from thy people to lodge the believers in their pitches for the battle -- God is All-hearing, All-knowing --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:122: when two parties of you were about to lose heart, though God was their Protector -- and in God let the believers put all their trust --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:123: and God most surely helped you at Badr, when you were utterly abject.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:124: When thou saidst to the believers, ’Is it not enough for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down upon you?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:125: Yea; if you are patient and godfearing, and the foe come against you instantly, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand swooping angels.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:126: God wrought this not, save as good tiding to you, and that your hearts might be at rest; help comes only from God the All-mighty, the All-wise;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:127: and that He might cut off a part of the unbelievers or frustrate them, so that they turned in their tracks, disappointed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:128: No part of the matter is thine, whether He turns towards them again, or chastises them; for they are evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:129: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and earth; He forgives whom He will, and chastises whom He will; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:130: O believers, devour not usury, doubled and redoubled, and fear you God; haply so you will prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:131: And fear the Fire prepared for the unbelievers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:132: and obey God and the Messenger; haply so you will find mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:133: And vie with one another, hastening to forgiveness from your Lord, and to a garden whose breadth is as the heavens and earth, prepared for the godfearing
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:134: who expend in prosperity and adversity in almsgiving, and restrain their rage, and pardon the offences of their fellowmen; and God loves the good-doers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:135: who, when they commit an indecency or wrong themselves, remember God, and pray forgiveness for their sins -- and who shall forgive sins but God? -- and do not persevere in the things they did and that wittingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:136: Those -- their recompense is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; and how excellent is the wage of those who labour!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:137: Divers institutions have passed away before you; journey in the land, and behold how was the end of those that cried lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:138: This is an exposition for mankind, and a guidance, and an admonition for such as are godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:139: Faint not, neither sorrow; you shall be the upper ones if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:140: If a wound touches you, a like wound already has touched the heathen; such days We deal out in turn among men, and that God may know who are the believers, and that He may take witnesses from among you; and God loves not the evildoers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:141: and that God may prove the believers, and blot out the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:142: Or did you suppose you should enter Paradise without God know who of you have struggled and who are patient?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:143: You were longing for death before you met it; now you have seen it, while you were beholding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:144: Muhammad is naught but a Messenger; Messengers have passed away before him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:145: It is not given to any soul to die, save by the leave of God, at an appointed time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:146: Many a Prophet there has been, with whom thousands manifold have fought, and they fainted not for what smote them in God’s way, neither weakened, nor did they humble themselves; and God loves the patient.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:147: Nothing else they said but, ’Lord, forgive us our sins, and that we exceeded in our affair, and make firm our feet, and help us against the people of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:148: And God gave them the reward of this world and the fairest reward of the world to come; and God loves the good-doers.
