Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:149: O believers, if you obey the unbelievers they will turn you upon your heels, and you will turn about, losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:150: No; but God is your Protector, and He is the best of helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:151: We will cast into the hearts of the unbelievers terror, for that they have associated with God that for which He sent down never authority; their lodging shall be the Fire; evil is the lodging of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:152: God has been true in His promise towards you when you blasted them by His leave; until you lost heart, and quarrelled about the matter, and were rebellious, after He had shown you that you longed for.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:153: When you were going up, not twisting about for anyone, and the Messenger was calling you in your rear; so He rewarded you with grief on grief that you might not sorrow for what escaped you neither for what smote you; and God is aware of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:154: Then He sent down upon you, after grief, security -- a slumber overcoming a party of you; and a party themselves had grieved, thinking of God thoughts that were not true such as the pagans thought, saying, ’Have we any part whatever in the affair?’ Say: ’The affair belongs to God entirely.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:155: Those of you who turned away the day the two hosts encountered -- Satan made them slip for somewhat they had earned; but God has pardoned them; God is All-forgiving, All-clement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:156: O believers, be not as the unbelievers who say to their brothers, when they journey in the land, or are upon expeditions, ’If they had been with us, they would not have died and not been slain’ -- that God may make that an anguish in their hearts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:157: If you are slain or die in God’s way, forgiveness and mercy from God are a better thing than that you amass;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:158: surely if you die or are slain, it is unto God you shall be mustered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:159: It was by some mercy of God that thou wast gentle to them; hadst thou been harsh and hard of heart, they would have scattered from about thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:160: If God helps you, none can overcome you; but if He forsakes you, who then can help you after Him? Therefore in God let the believers put all their trust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:161: It is not for a Prophet to be fraudulent; whoso defrauds shall bring the fruits of his fraud on the Day of Resurrection; then every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:162: What, is he who follows God’s good pleasure like him who is laden with the burden of God’s anger, whose refuge is Gehenna? An evil homecoming!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:163: They are in ranks with God; and God sees the things they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:164: Truly God was gracious to the believers when He raised up among them a Messenger from themselves, to recite to them His signs and to purify them, and to teach them the Book and the Wisdom, though before they were in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:165: Why, when an affliction visited you, and you had visited twice over the like of it, did you say, ’How is this?’ Say: ’This is from your own selves; surely God is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:166: And what visited you, the day the two hosts encountered, was by God’s leave, and that He might know the believers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:167: and that He might also know the hypocrites when it was said of them, ’Come now, fight in the way of God, or repel!’ They said, ’If only we knew how to fight, we would follow you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:168: who said of their brothers (and they themselves held back), ’Had they obeyed us, they would not have been slain.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:169: Count not those who were slain in God’s way as dead, but rather living with their Lord, by Him provided,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:170: rejoicing in the bounty that God has given them, and joyful in those who remain behind and have not joined them, because no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:171: joyful in blessing and bounty from God, and that God leaves not to waste the wage of the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:172: And those who answered God and the Messenger after the wound had smitten them - to all those of them who did good and feared God, shall be a mighty wage;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:173: those to whom the people said, ’The people have gathered against you, therefore fear them’, but it increased them in faith, and they said, ’God is sufficient for us; an excellent Guardian is He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:174: So they returned with blessing and bounty from God, untouched by evil; they followed the good pleasure of God; and God is of bounty abounding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:175: That is Satan frightening his friends, therefore do not fear them; but fear you Me, if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:176: Let them not grieve thee that vie with one another in unbelief; they will nothing hurt God; God desires not to appoint for them a portion in the world to come, and there awaits them a mighty chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:177: Those who buy unbelief at the price of faith, they will nothing hurt God; and there awaits them a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:178: And let not the unbelievers suppose that the indulgence We grant them is better for them; We grant them indulgence only that they may increase in sin; and there awaits them a humbling chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:179: God will not leave the believers in the state in which you are, till He shall distinguish the corrupt from the good, and God will not inform you of the Unseen; but God chooses out of His Messengers whom He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:180: But as for those who are niggardly with the bounty God has given them, let them not suppose it is better for them; nay, it is worse for them; that they were niggardly with they shall have hung about their necks on the Resurrection Day; and to God belongs the inheritance of the heavens and earth; and God is aware of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:181: God has heard the saying of those who said, ’Surely God is poor, and we are rich.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:182: that, for what your hands have forwarded, and for that God is never unjust unto His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:183: Those same men said, ’God has made covenant with us, that we believe not any Messenger until he brings to us a sacrifice devoured by fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:184: But if they cry lies to thee, lies were cried to Messengers before thee, who came bearing clear signs, and the Psalms, and the Book Illuminating.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:185: Every soul shall taste of death; you she surely be paid in full your wages on the Day of Resurrection.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:186: You shall surely be tried in your possessions and your selves, and you shall hear from those who were given the Book before you, and from those who are idolaters, much hurt; but if you are patient and godfearing -- surely that is true constancy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:187: And when God took compact with those who had been given the Book: ’You shall make it clear unto the people, and not conceal it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:188: Reckon not that those who rejoice in what they have brought, and love to be praised for what they have not done -- do not reckon them secure from chastisement; for them awaits a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:189: To God belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and of the earth; and God is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:190: Surely in the creation of the heavens and earth and in the alternation of night and day there are signs for men possessed of minds
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:191: who remember God, standing and sitting and on their sides, and reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: ’Our Lord, Thou hast not created this for vanity.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:192: Our Lord, whomsoever Thou admittest into the Fire, Thou wilt have abased; and the evildoers shall have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:193: Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling us to belief, saying, "Believe you in your Lord!" And we believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:194: Our Lord, give us what Thou hast promised us by Thy Messengers, and abase us not on the Day of Resurrection; Thou wilt not fail the tryst.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:195: And their Lord answers them: ’I waste not the labour of any that labours among you, be you male or female -- the one of you is as the other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:196: Let it not delude thee, that the unbelievers go to and fro in the land;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:197: a little enjoyment, then their refuge is Gehenna -- an evil cradling!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:198: But those who fear their Lord - for them shall be gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever -- a hospitality God Himself offers; and that which is with God is better for the pious.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:199: And some there are of the People of the Book who believe in God, and what has been sent down unto you, and what has been sent down unto them, men humble to God, not selling the signs of God for a small price; those -- their wage is with their Lord; God is swift at the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 3:200: O believers, be patient, and vie you in patience; be steadfast; fear God; haply so you will prosper.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:2: GOD – there is no deity save Him, the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsistent Fount of All Being!
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:3: Step by step has He bestowed upon thee from on high this divine writ, setting forth the truth which confirms whatever there still remains [of earlier revelations]: for it is He who has bestowed from on high the Torah and the Gospel
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:4: aforetime, as a guidance unto mankind, and it is He who has bestowed [upon man] the standard by which to discern the true from the false.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:5: Verily, nothing on earth or in the heavens is hidden from God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:6: He it is who shapes you in the wombs as He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:7: He it is who has bestowed upon thee from on high this divine writ, containing messages that are clear in and by themselves – and these are the essence of the divine writ – as well as others that are allegorical.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:8: "O our Sustainer! Let not our hearts swerve from the truth after Thou hast guided us; and bestow upon us the gift of Thy grace: verily, Thou art the
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:10: "O our Sustainer! Verily, Thou wilt gather mankind together to witness the Day about [the coming of] which there is no doubt: verily, God never fails to fulfil His promise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:11: BEHOLD, as for those who are bent on denying the truth – neither their worldly possessions nor their offspring will in the least avail them against God; and it is they, they who shall be the fuel of the fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:12: [To them shall happen] the like of what happened to Pharaoh’s people and those who lived before them: they gave the lie to Our messages – and so God took them to task for their sins: for God is severe in retribution.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:13: Say unto those who are bent on denying the truth: "You shall be overcome and gathered unto hell – and how evil a resting-place!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:14: You have already had a sign in the two hosts that met in battle, one host fighting in God’s cause and the other denying Him; with their own eyes [the former] saw the others as twice their own number: but God strengthens with His succour whom He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:15: ALLURING unto man is the enjoyment of worldly desires through women, and children, and heaped-up treasures of gold and silver, and horses of high mark, and cattle, and lands.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:16: Say: "Shall I tell you of better things than those [earthly joys]? For the God-conscious there are, with their Sustainer, gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide, and spouses pure, and God’s goodly acceptance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:17: those who say, "O our Sustainer! Behold, we believe [in Thee]; forgive us, then, our sins, and keep us safe from suffering through the fire" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:18: those who are patient in adversity, and true to their word, and truly devout, and who spend [in God’s way], and pray for forgiveness from their innermost hearts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:20: proffers evidence – and [so do] the angels and all who are endowed with knowledge – that there is no deity save Him, the Upholder of Equity: there is no deity save Him, the Almighty, the Truly Wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:22: religion in the sight of God is
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:23: self-surrender unto Him; and those who were vouchsafed revelation aforetime took, out of mutual jealousy, to divergent views [on this point] only after knowledge
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:25: Thus, [O Prophet,] if they argue with thee, say, "I have surrendered my whole being unto God, and [so have] all who follow me!" – and ask those who have been vouchsafed revelation aforetime, as well as all unlettered people, "Have you
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:26: surrendered yourselves unto Him?" And if they surrender themselves unto Him, they are on the right path; but if they turn away – behold, thy duty is no more than to deliver the message: for God sees all that is in [the hearts of] His creatures.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:27: Verily, as for those who deny the truth of God’s messages, and slay the prophets against all right, and slay people who enjoin equity – announce unto them a grievous chastisement.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:28: It is they whose works shall come to nought both in this world and in the life to come; and they shall have none to succour them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:29: Art thou not aware of those who have been granted their share of revelation ?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:30: They have been called upon to let God’s writ be their law – and yet some of them turn away [from it] in their obstinacy,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:31: simply because they claim, "The fire will most certainly not touch us for more than a limited number of days": and thus the false beliefs which they invented have [in time] caused them to betray their faith.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:32: How, then, [will they fare] when We shall gather them all together to witness the Day about [the coming of] which there is no doubt, and every human being shall be repaid in full for what he has done, and none shall be wronged?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:33: SAY: "O God, Lord of all dominion! Thou grantest dominion unto whom Thou willest, and takest away dominion from whom Thou willest; and Thou exaltest whom Thou willest, and abasest whom Thou willest.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:34: "Thou makest the night grow longer by shortening the day, and Thou makest the day grow longer by shortening the night.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:35: LET NOT the believers take those who deny the truth for their allies in preference to the believers – since he who does this cuts himself off from God in everything – unless it be to protect yourselves against them in this way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:36: Say: "Whether you conceal what is in your hearts or bring it into the open, God knows it: for He knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth; and God has the power to will anything.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:37: On the Day when every human being will find himself faced with all the good that he has done, and with all the evil that he has done, [many a one] will wish that there were a long span of time between himself and that .
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:38: Hence, God warns you to beware of Him; but God is most compassionate towards His creatures.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:39: Say [O Prophet]: "If you love God, follow me
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:40: God will love you and forgive you your sins; for God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:41: Say: "Pay heed unto God and the Apostle.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:42: BEHOLD, God raised Adam, and Noah, and the House of Abraham, and the House of ’Imrān above all mankind,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:44: when a woman of [the House of] ’Imrān prayed: "O my Sustainer! Behold, unto Thee do I vow [the child] that is in my womb, to be devoted to Thy service.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:45: But when she had given birth to the child, she said: "O my Sustainer! Behold, I have given birth to a female" – the while God had been fully aware of what she would give birth to, and [fully aware] that no male child [she might have hoped for] could ever have been like this female – "and I have named her Mary.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:46: And so her Sustainer accepted her with goodly acceptance, and caused her to grow up in goodly growth, and placed her in the care of Zachariah.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:47: In that self-same place, Zachariah prayed unto his Sustainer, saying: "O my Sustainer! Bestow upon me ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:48: out of Thy grace, the gift of goodly offspring; for Thou, indeed, hearest all prayer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:49: Thereupon, as he stood praying in the sanctuary, the angels called out unto him: "God sends thee the glad tiding of [the birth of] John, who shall confirm the truth of a word from God, and [shall be] outstanding among men, and utterly chaste, and a prophet from among the righteous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:51: exclaimed: "O my Sustainer! How can I have a son when old age has already overtaken me, and my wife is barren?" Answered [the angel]: "Thus it is: God does what He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:53: prayed: "O my Sustainer! Appoint a sign for me!" Said [the angel]: "Thy sign shall be that for three days thou wilt not speak unto men other than by gestures.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:54: AND LO! The angels said: "O Mary! Behold, God has elected thee and made thee pure, and raised thee above all the women of the world.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:55: O Mary! Remain thou truly devout unto thy Sustainer, and prostrate thyself in worship, and bow down with those who bow down [before Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:56: This account of something that was beyond the reach of thy perception We
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:57: reveal unto thee: for thou wert not with them when they drew lots as to which of them should be Mary’s guardian, and thou wert not with them when they contended [about it] with one another.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:58: Lo! The angels said: "O Mary! Behold, God sends thee the glad tiding, through a word from Him, [of a son] who shall become known as the Christ Jesus, son of Mary, of great honour in this world and in the life to come, and [shall be] of those who are drawn near unto God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:59: And he shall speak unto men in his cradle, and as a grown man, and shall be of the righteous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:60: Said she: "O my Sustainer! How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me?" [The angel] answered: "Thus it is: God creates what He wills: when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, ‘Be’ – and it is.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:61: And He will impart unto thy son revelation, and wisdom, and the Torah, and the Gospel,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:62: and [will make him] an apostle unto the children of Israel.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:63: destiny, and then breathe into it, so that it might become
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:64: destiny by God’s leave: and I shall heal the blind and the leper, and bring the dead back to life by God’s leave: and I shall let you know what you may eat and what you should store up in your houses.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:66: "And [I have come] to confirm the truth of whatever there still remains of the Torah, and to make lawful unto you some of the things which
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:68: "Verily, God is my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer: so worship Him :
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:70: And when Jesus became aware of their refusal to acknowledge the truth, he asked: "Who will be my helpers in God’s cause?" The white-garbed ones replied: "We shall be
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:71: helpers [in the cause] of God! We believe in God: and bear thou witness that we have surrendered ourselves unto Him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:72: O our Sustainer! We believe in what Thou hast bestowed from on high, and we follow this Apostle; make us one, then, with all who bear witness [to the truth]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:73: And the unbelievers schemed [against Jesus]; but God brought their scheming to nought: for God is above all schemers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:74: Lo! God said: "O Jesus! Verily, I shall cause thee to die, and shall exalt thee unto Me, and cleanse thee of [the presence of] those who are bent on denying the truth; and I shall place those who follow thee
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:75: above those who are bent on denying the truth, unto the Day of Resurrection.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:76: "And as for those who are bent on denying the truth, I shall cause them to suffer a suffering severe in this world and in the life to come, and they shall have none to succour them;
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:77: whereas unto those who attain to faith and do good works He will grant their reward in full: for God does not love evildoers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:78: THIS MESSAGE do We convey unto thee, and this tiding full of wisdom:
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:79: Verily, in the sight of God, the nature of Jesus is as the nature of Adam, whom He created out of dust and then said unto him, "Be" – and he is.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:80: [This is] the truth from thy Sustainer; be not, then, among the doubters!
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:81: And if anyone should argue with thee about this
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:82: after all the knowledge that has come unto thee, say: "Come! Let us summon our sons and your sons, and our women and your women, and ourselves and yourselves; and then let us pray
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:83: humbly and ardently, and let us invoke God’s curse upon those [of us] who are telling a lie.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:84: Behold, this is indeed the truth of the matter, and there is no deity whatever save God; and, verily, God – He alone – is almighty, truly wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:85: And if they turn away [from this truth] – behold, God has full knowledge of the spreaders of corruption.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:86: Say: "O followers of earlier revelation! Come unto that tenet which we and you hold in common: that we shall worship none but God, and that we shall not ascribe divinity to aught beside Him, and that we shall not take human beings for our lords beside God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:87: O FOLLOWERS of earlier revelation! Why do you argue about Abraham, seeing that the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed till
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:88: after him? Will you not, then, use your reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:89: Lo! You are the ones who would argue about that which is known to you; but why do you argue about something which is unknown to you? Yet God knows ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:91: Abraham was neither a "Jew" nor a "Christian," but was one who turned away from all that is false, having surrendered himself unto God; and he was not of those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:92: Behold, the people who have the best claim to Abraham are surely those who follow him – as does this Prophet and all who believe [in him] – and God is near unto the believers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:93: Some of the followers of earlier revelation would love to lead you astray: yet none do they lead astray but themselves, and perceive it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:94: O followers of earlier revelation! Why do you deny the truth of God’s messages to which you yourselves bear witness?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:95: O followers of earlier revelation! Why do you cloak the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth of which you are [so well] aware?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:96: And some of the followers of earlier revelation say [to one another]: "Declare your belief in what has been revealed unto those who believe [in Muhammad] at the beginning of the day, and deny the truth of what came later, so that they might go back [on their faith];
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:98: believe anyone who does not follow your own faith.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:99: guidance is God’s guidance, consisting in one’s being granted
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:100: such as you have been granted.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:101: singling out for His grace whom He wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:102: AND AMONG the followers of earlier revelation there is many a one who, if thou entrust him with a treasure, will
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:103: restore it to thee; and there is among them many a one who, if thou entrust him with a tiny gold coin, will not restore it to thee unless thou keep standing over him – which is an outcome of their assertion, "No blame can attach to us [for anything that we may do] with regard to these unlettered folk": and
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:104: they tell a lie about God, being well aware [that it is a lie].
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:105: Nay, but [God is aware of] those who keep their bond with Him, and are conscious of Him: and, verily, God loves those who are conscious of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:106: Behold, those who barter away their bond with God and their own pledges for a trifling gain – they shall not partake in the blessings of the life to come; and God will neither speak unto them nor look upon them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He cleanse them of their sins; and grievous suffering awaits them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:107: And, behold, there are indeed some among them who distort the Bible with their tongues, so as to make you think that [what they say] is from the Bible, the while it is not from the Bible; and who say, "This is from God," the while it is not from God: and thus do they tell a lie about God, being well aware [that it is a lie].
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:108: It is not conceivable that a human being unto whom God had granted revelation, and sound judgment, and prophethood, should thereafter have said unto people, "Worship me beside God"; but rather [did he exhort them], "Become men of God by spreading the knowledge of the divine writ, and by your own deep study .
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:109: And neither did he bid you to take the angels and the prophets for your lords:
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:110: would he bid you to deny the truth after you have surrendered yourselves unto God?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:111: AND, LO, God accepted, through the prophets, this solemn pledge [from the followers of earlier revelation]: "If, after all the revelation and the wisdom which I have vouchsafed unto you, there comes to you an apostle confirming the truth already in your possession, you must believe in him and succour him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:112: and I shall be your witness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:113: And, henceforth, all who turn away [from this pledge] – it is they, they who are truly iniquitous!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:114: Do they seek, perchance, a faith other than in God, although it is unto Him that whatever is in the heavens and on earth surrenders itself, willingly or unwillingly, since unto Him all must return?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:115: Say: "We believe in God, and in that which has been bestowed from on high upon us, and that which has been bestowed upon Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their descendants, and that which has been vouchsafed by their Sustainer unto Moses and Jesus and all the
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:116: prophets: we make no distinction between any of them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:117: For, if one goes in search of a religion other than self-surrender unto God, it will never be accepted from him, and in the life to come he shall be among the lost.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:118: How would God bestow His guidance upon people who have resolved to deny the truth after having attained to faith, and having borne witness that this Apostle is true, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:119: all evidence of the truth has come unto them? For, God does not guide such evildoing folk.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:120: Their requital shall be rejection by God, and by the angels, and by all
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:122: In this state shall they abide;
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:123: neither will their suffering be lightened, nor will they be granted respite.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:130: Say: "God has spoken the truth: follow, then, the creed of Abraham, who turned away from all that is false, and was not of those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:134: Say: "O followers of earlier revelation! Muhammad Asad.verse 3:142: But as for those with faces shining, they shall be within God’s grace, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:143: These are God’s messages: We convey them unto thee, setting forth the truth, since God wills no wrong to His creation.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:144: And unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth; and all things go back to God [as their source].
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:145: YOU ARE indeed the best community that has ever been brought forth for [the good of] mankind: you enjoin the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong, and you believe in God.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:148: Overshadowed by ignominy are they wherever they may be, save [when they bind themselves again] in a bond with God and a bond with men; for they have earned the burden of God’s condemnation, and are overshadowed by humiliation: all this [has befallen them] because they persisted in denying the truth of God’s messages and in slaying the prophets against all right: all this, because they rebelled [against God], and persisted in transgressing the bounds of what is right.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:150: they are not all alike: among the followers of earlier revelation there are upright people, who recite God’s messages throughout the night, and prostrate themselves [before Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:151: They believe in God and the Last Day, and enjoin the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong, and vie with one another in doing good works: and these are among the righteous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:152: And whatever good they do, they shall never be denied the reward thereof: for God has full knowledge of those who are conscious of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:154: behold, as for those who are bent on denying the truth – neither their worldly possessions nor their children will in the least avail them against God: and it is they who are destined for the fire, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:155: The parable of what they spend on the life of this world is that of an icy wind which smites the tilth of people who have sinned against themselves, and destroys it: for it is not God who does them wrong, but it is they who are wronging themselves.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:163: [And remember] when thou didst say unto the believers: "Is it not enough for you [to know] that your Sustainer will aid you with three thousand angels sent down [from on high]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:164: Nay, but if you are patient in adversity and conscious of Him, and the enemy should fall upon you of a sudden, your Sustainer will aid you with five thousand angels swooping down!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:165: And God ordained this [to be said by His Apostle] only as a glad tiding for you, and that your hearts should thereby be set at rest – since no succour can come from any save God, the Almighty, the Truly Wise –
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:167: that [through you] He might destroy some of those who were bent on denying the truth, and so abase the others that they would withdraw in utter hopelessness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:169: it is in no wise for thee [O Prophet] to decide whether He shall accept their repentance or chastise them – for, behold, they are but wrongdoers,
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:170: whereas unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth: He forgives whom He wills, and He chastises whom He wills; and God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:171: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not gorge yourselves on usury, doubling and re-doubling it – but remain conscious of God, so that you might attain to a happy state;
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:172: and beware of the fire which awaits those who deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:173: And pay heed unto God and the Apostle, so that you might be graced with mercy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:174: And vie with one another to attain to your Sustainer’s forgiveness and to a paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth, which has been readied for the God-conscious

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:176: and who, when they have committed a shameful deed or have

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:182: this [should be] a clear lesson unto all men, and a guidance and an admonition unto the God-conscious.

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:185: If misfortune touches you, [know that] similar misfortune has touched

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:194: And how many a prophet has had to fight [in God’s cause], followed by many God-devoted men: and they did not become faint of heart for all that they had to suffer in God’s cause, and neither did they weaken, nor did they abase themselves [before the enemy], since God loves those who are patient in adversity;
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:195: and all that they said was this: "O our Sustainer! Forgive us our sins and the lack of moderation in our doings! And make firm our steps, and succour us against people who deny the truth!" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:196: whereupon God granted them the rewards of this world, as well as the goodliest rewards of the life to come: for God loves the doers of good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:197: O YOU who have attained to faith! If you pay heed to those who are bent on denying the truth, they will cause you to turn back on your heels, and you will be the losers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:198: Nay, but God alone is your Lord Supreme, and His is the best succour.
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:199: Into the hearts of those who are bent on denying the truth We shall cast dread in return for their ascribing divinity, side by side with God, to other beings –
Muhammad Asad.verse 3:200: for which He has never bestowed any warrant from on high; and their goal is the fire – and how evil that abode of evildoers!

Muhammad Asad.verse 3:205: [Remember the time] when you fled, paying no heed to anyone, while at your rear the Apostle was calling out to you – wherefore He requited you with woe in return for [the Apostle’s] woe, so that you should not grieve

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:2: Allah: There is no god but He, the Alive, the All-Sustaining.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:3: He has revealed to you the Book with the truth, confirming what has been before it, and has sent down the Torah and the Injīl
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:4: earlier to give guidance to mankind, and has sent down the Furqān (the Criterion of right and wrong).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:5: Surely, Allah is such that nothing is hidden from Him, neither in the earth nor in the sky.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:6: He is the One Who shapes you in the wombs as He likes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:7: He is the One who has revealed to you the Book (the Qur’ān).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:8: “Our Lord, do not let our hearts deviate from the right path after You have given us guidance, and bestow upon us mercy from Your own.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:9: Our Lord, You are going to assemble all the people on a day in (the occurrence of) which there is no doubt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:10: Surely, those who disbelieve, their wealth and their children shall not suffice them in the least against Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:11: a case similar to that of the House of Pharaoh and those before them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:12: Say to those who disbelieve: “You shall soon be overcome and shall be gathered into Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:13: “There was a sign for you in the two groups who confronted each other: One group fighting in the way of Allah, and the other disbelieving, seeing themselves as twice their number, with open eyes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:14: It has been made attractive for people to love the desired things; that is, women, children, hoarded heaps of gold and silver, branded horses, cattle and tillage.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:15: Say: “Shall I tell you what is far better than that? For those who fear (Allah), there are gardens with their Lord, beneath which rivers flow, where they shall live forever, with purified wives, and approval from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:16: Those (are the ones) who say: “Our Lord, surely we have believed, so forgive us our sins and save us from the punishment of the Fire,”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:17: (and those who are) the patient, the truthful and the devout, who spend (in Allah’s way) and who seek forgiveness in pre-dawn hours.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:18: Allah bears witness that there is no god but He - and (so do) the angels and the men of knowledge - being the One who maintains equity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:19: Truly, the (recognized) religion in the sight of Allah is Islām .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:20: Then, if they argue with you, say: “I have submitted myself to Allah, and (so did) those who have followed me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:21: Surely, those who reject the verses of Allah and slay the prophets unjustly, and slay those of the people who bid justice, give them ‘the good news’ of a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:22: Those are the ones whose deeds have gone to waste in this world and in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:23: Did you not observe those who have been given a share from the Book? They are invited to the Book of Allah, so that it may decide between them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:24: That is because they have said: “The Fire shall not touch us except for a few days.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:25: Then, how (will it be) when We will gather them together on a day about which there is no doubt, and everybody will be paid in full for what he has earned, and they shall not be wronged?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:26: Say: “O Allah, O Lord of the Kingdom, You give kingdom to whom You will, and take kingdom away from whom You will; and You bestow honor on whom You will, and bring disgrace to whom You will.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:27: You make the night enter into the day, and make the day enter into the night; and You bring the living out from the dead, and bring the dead out from the living, and You give to whom You will beyond measure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:28: The believers must not take the disbelievers as friends instead of the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:29: Say: “Whether you conceal what is in your hearts or reveal it, Allah will know it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:30: On the day when everybody shall find present before him whatever good he did and whatever evil he wrought, he will wish there would have been a wide space between him and that (day).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:31: Say (O Prophet): “If you really love Allah, then follow me, and Allah shall love you and forgive you your sins.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:33: Verily, Allah has chosen ’Ādam and NūH (Noah) and the House of Ibrāhīm and the House of ‘Imrān over all the worlds
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:34: - a progeny some of whom resembles the others (in faith).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:35: (Remember) when ‘Imrān’s wife said: “O my Lord, I have vowed that what is in my womb will be devoted exclusively for You.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:36: So, when she delivered her, she said: “O my Lord, I have delivered her, a female child.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:37: So, her Lord accepted her, a good acceptance, and made her grow, a good growth, and made Zakariyyā her guardian.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:38: Thereupon, Zakariyyā prayed to his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:39: So then, when he stood praying in the place of worship, the angels called out to him saying: “Allah gives you the good news of YaHyā who shall come to confirm a word of Allah and shall be a chief, abstinent (from women), a prophet and one of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:40: He said: “O my Lord, how shall I have a boy when old age has come upon me and my wife is barren?” Said He: “That is how Allah does what He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:41: He said: “O my Lord, set for me a sign.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:42: And when the angels said: “O Maryam, Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you over the women of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:43: O Maryam, stand in devotion to your Lord and prostrate yourself and bow down in Rukū‘ with those who bow.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:44: This is a part of the news of the unseen We reveal to you (O Prophet!).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:45: (Remember the time) when the angels said: “O Maryam, Allah gives you the good news of a Word from Him whose name is MasīH ‘Īsā , the son of Maryam (the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary) a man of status in this world and in the Hereafter, and one of those who are near (to Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:46: He shall speak to people while (he is still) in the cradle, and also later, when he is of mature age; and he shall be one of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:47: She said: “O my Lord, how shall I have a son while no human has ever touched me?” Said He: “That is how Allah creates what He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:48: He shall teach him the Book and the Wisdom, and the Torah and the Injīl,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:49: and (shall make him) a messenger to the Children of Isrā’īl (who will say to them): “I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, that is, I create for you from clay something in the shape of a bird, then I blow in it, and it becomes a living bird by the will of Allah; and I cure the born-blind and the leper, and I cause the dead to become alive by the will of Allah; and I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your homes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:50: (I have come to you) confirming that (book) which is (sent down) prior to me, that is, the Torah, and to make permissible for you some of what was prohibited to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:51: Allah is surely my Lord and your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:52: So, when ‘Īsā sensed disbelief in them, he said: “Who are my helpers in the way of Allah?” The disciples said: “We are helpers of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:53: “Our Lord, we have believed in what You have revealed, and we have followed the messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:54: They (the opponents of ‘Īsā) devised a plan, and Allah devised a plan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:55: When Allah said: “O ‘Īsā , I am to take you in full and to raise you towards Myself, and to cleanse you of those who disbelieve, and to place those who follow you above those who disbelieve up to the Day of Doom.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:56: As for those who disbelieve, I shall punish them a severe punishment in this world and in the Hereafter; and for them there are no helpers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:57: As for those who believe and do good deeds, He (Allah) will give them their rewards in full.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:58: This We recite to you of the Verses and the Message that is full of wisdom.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:59: Surely, the case of ‘Īsā , in the sight of Allah, is like the case of ’Edam .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:60: The truth is from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:61: If someone argues with you (O Prophet) over this after the knowledge that has come to you, say (to him), “Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then (let us) pray and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:62: This is, indeed, the true narration.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:63: So, should they turn back, Allah is fully aware of the mischievous people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:64: Say, “O people of the Book, come to a word common between us and between you, that we worship none but Allah, that we associate nothing with Him and that some of us do not take others as Lords instead of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:65: O people of the Book, why do you argue about Ibrāhīm, while the Torah and the Injīl were not revealed until after him? Have you, then, no sense?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:66: Look, this is what you are - you have already argued about matters concerning which you have knowledge; why then do you argue about matters of which you have no knowledge? Allah knows and you do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:67: Ibrāhīm was neither a Jew nor a Christian.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:68: The closest of people to Ibrāhīm are those who followed him, and this prophet, and those who believe; and Allah is the Guardian of all believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:69: A group from the people of the Book loves to mislead you, while they mislead none but themselves, and they do not realize.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:70: O people of the Book, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah (revealed in the former Scriptures to foretell about the advent of the Holy Prophet ?) while you are yourselves witnesses (to those verses)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:71: O People of the Book, why do you confound the truth with falsehood, and conceal the truth when you know (the reality)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:72: And a group from the people of the Book said (to their people), “Believe in what has been revealed to the believers in the early part of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it, so that they may turn back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:73: But do not believe (for real) except in those who follow your faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:74: He chooses for His grace whom He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:75: Among the people of the Book there is one who, if you entrust him with a heap (of gold or silver), will give it back to you; and among them there is one who, if you entrust him with a single dīnār (a coin of gold), he will not give it back to you, unless you keep standing over him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:76: Why (will they) not (be blamed)? Whoever fulfils his pledge and fears Allah, then, Allah loves the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:77: Surely, those who take a small price by (breaking) the covenant of Allah and their oaths, for them there is no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will neither speak to them, nor will He look towards them on the Day of Judgment, nor will He purify them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:78: Among them there is indeed a group who twist their tongues while (reading) the Book, so that you may deem it to be from the Book, while it is not from the Book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:79: It is not (possible) for a man that Allah gives him the Book, the wisdom and the prophethood, then he starts saying to the people “Become my worshippers, aside from Allah” rather, (he would say), “Be men of the Lord; as you have been teaching the Book, and as you have been learning it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:80: Nor is it (possible for him) that he bids you to hold the angels and the prophets as Lords.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:81: When Allah made the prophets enter into a covenant: (saying) “If I give you a book and wisdom, then comes to you a messenger verifying what is with you, you shall have to believe in him, and you shall have to support him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:82: Then those who turn back after this, they are the sinful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:83: Are they, then, seeking a religion other than that of Allah, while to Him alone submit all those in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwilling, and to Him they shall be returned?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:84: Say, “We believe in Allah and in what has been revealed to us and in what was revealed to Ibrāhīm, Ismā‘īl, IsHāq , Ya‘qūb and the descendants, and in what has been given to Mūsā, ‘Īsā and the prophets, from their Lord: We do not differentiate between any of them; and to Him we submit ourselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:85: Whoever seeks a faith other than Islam, it will never be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:86: How shall Allah give guidance to a people who disbelieved after they had accepted Faith and testified that the Prophet is true and the clear signs had come to them? Allah does not give guidance to the unjust people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:87: The punishment of such people is that upon them is the curse of Allah, of the angels and of the human beings altogether.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:88: They will remain under it forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:89: except those who repent afterwards and mend their ways.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:90: Those who disbelieve after having accepted Faith and then increase in disbelief, their repentance shall never be accepted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:91: Those who disbelieve and die as disbelievers, even an Earth-full of gold shall never be accepted from any of them, even if one were to offer it as ransom.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:92: You shall never attain righteousness unless you spend from what you love.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:93: Every (kind of) food was lawful for the children of Isrā’īl, except what Isrā’īl had made unlawful for himself, well before the Torah was revealed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:94: Then those who forge the lie against Allah, after all this,- they are the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:96: The first house set up for the people is surely the one in Makkah having blessings and guidance for all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:97: In it there are clear signs: The Station of Ibrāhīm! Whoever enters it is secure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:98: Say, “O people of the Book, why do you reject the verses of Allah while Allah is witness to what you do?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:99: Say, “O people of the Book, why do you hinder the believers from the way of Allah, trying to create crookedness in it, while you yourselves are witnesses (to its being the right way)? Allah is not oblivious of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:100: O you who believe, if you obey a group from those who have been given the Book (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:101: How could you disbelieve while you are the ones to whom the verses of Allah are recited, and present amidst you is His Messenger? Whoever holds on to Allah, is surely led to the straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:102: O you who believe, fear Allah, as He should be feared, and let not yourself die save as Muslims.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:103: Hold fast, all of you, to the cord of Allah, and be not divided.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:104: There has to be a group of people from among you who call towards the good, and bid the Fair and forbid the Unfair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:105: Do not be like those who became divided and fell into disputes after the clear signs had come to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:106: on a day when some faces shall turn bright, and some faces shall turn dark.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:107: As for those whose faces turn bright, they will rest in Allah’s mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:108: These are the verses of Allah We recite to you with all veracity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:109: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:110: You are the best ‘Ummah ever raised for mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:111: They shall never (be able to) cause you any harm except a little hurt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:112: Disgrace has been stamped over them wherever they are found, unless (saved) through a source from Allah and through a source from men, and they have returned with wrath from Allah, and misery has been stamped over them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:113: Not all of them are alike: Among the people of the Book there are those who are steadfast; they recite the verses of Allah in the night hours, and they prostrate themselves;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:114: they believe in Allah and the Hereafter, and bid the Fair and forbid the Unfair, and hasten towards good deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:115: Whatever good they do, they shall never go unappreciated for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:116: Surely, those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their children shall help them against Allah; and they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:117: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is just like a wind that, having chill within, struck the tillage of those who wronged themselves, and destroyed it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:118: O you who believe, do not take anyone as an insider but those from among your own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:119: Look, you are the ones who love them and they do not love you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:120: If something good happens to you, it annoys them, and if something evil befalls you, they are delighted with it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:121: Recall the time when you left your house in the morning in order to place the believers in positions for fighting.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:122: When two of your groups were about to lose heart, while Allah was their guardian! It is in Allah alone that the believers must place their trust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:123: Allah certainly supported you at Badr when you were weak.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:124: When you were saying to the believers, “Shall it not suffice you that your Lord should help you with three thousand of the angels sent down (for you)?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:125: Of course, if you stay patient and fear Allah, and they come upon you even in this heat of theirs, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand of the angels, each having distinct marks.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:126: And Allah did this solely to make it a good news for you, and so that your hearts may be at rest with it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:127: (Allah helped you) so that He may cut off a flank of disbelievers or throw them down in disgrace, and they go back frustrated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:128: You have no authority in the matter, unless Allah forgives them or punishes them, as they are unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:129: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:130: O you who believe, do not eat up the amounts acquired through Ribā (interest), doubled and multiplied.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:131: and fear the Fire that has been prepared for the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:132: Obey Allah and the Messenger, so that you may be blessed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:133: Race with one another towards Forgiveness from your Lord and towards a paradise the width of which spans the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:134: -the ones who spend (for Allah’s sake) in prosperity and adversity, and those who control anger and forgive people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:135: -and those who, when they happen to commit a shameful act or wrong themselves, remember Allah, then, seek forgiveness for their sins-and who is there to forgive sins except Allah?-and do not persist in what they have done, knowingly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:136: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow where they shall live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:137: Many patterns of behavior have passed before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:138: This is a declaration for mankind, and guidance, and a lesson for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:139: Do not lose heart and do not grieve, and you are the upper-most if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:140: If you have received a wound, they have received a similar wound.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:141: - and so that Allah may purify those who believe and eradicate the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:142: Do you think that you shall enter Paradise even before Allah knows those of you who carry out Jihād and those who are steadfast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:143: You had longed for death before you faced it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:144: MuHammad is but a messenger, there have been messengers before him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:145: It is not the choice of a person to die without the will of Allah, death being a time-bound destiny.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:146: There have been many prophets with whom many men of Allah have fought; they did not lose heart for what they suffered in the way of Allah, nor did they become weak, nor did they yield.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:147: They had nothing else to say except that they said: “Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our conduct, make firm our feet and help us against the disbelieving people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:148: So, Allah gave them the return in this world and also the better rewards in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:149: O you who believe, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will make you turn back on your heels, then you shall turn into losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:150: Instead, Allah is your Lord, and He is the best of all helpers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:151: We shall put awe into the hearts of those who disbelieve, since they have associated with Allah something for which He has not sent any authority.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:152: Allah has surely fulfilled His promise to you when you, with His will, were killing them off, until you showed weakness and disputed in the matter and disobeyed after He had shown you what you liked.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:153: When you were going away, not even turning to look at anyone, and the Messenger was calling you from behind you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:154: Then, after the grief, He poured tranquility upon you - a drowsiness overtaking a group of you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:155: Surely, those of you who turned back on the day when the two troops faced each other, Satan had but made them slip for some of their deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:156: O you who believe, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brethren while they travelled on the earth or had to fight, “Had they been with us, they would have not died, nor would they have been killed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:157: If you are killed in the way of Allah or die, the forgiveness from Allah and the mercy is far better than what they accumulate
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:158: If you die or get killed, it is towards Allah that you shall be gathered.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:159: So, (O Prophet) it is through mercy from Allah that you are gentle to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:160: If Allah helps you, there is none to overcome you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:161: It is not conceivable from a prophet to misappropriate the spoils.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:162: How then, could one who submits to the pleasure of Allah be equal to him who returns with displeasure from Allah? His ultimate place is the Fire; and what an evil end it is!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:163: They are of various ranks with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:164: Allah has surely conferred favor on the believers when He raised in their midst a messenger from among themselves who recites to them His verses and makes them pure and teaches them the Book and the Wisdom, while earlier, they were in open error.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:165: How is it that, when you suffered a hardship the twice of which you had inflicted upon them, you say, “Where did this come from?” Say, “This is from your own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:166: Whatever you suffered on the day when the two troops faced each other was by the will of Allah, and in order to know the believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:167: and in order to know those who are hypocrites.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:168: Those who said about their brethren, while themselves sitting, “Had they obeyed us, they would have not been killed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:169: Never take those killed in the way of Allah as dead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:170: happy with what Allah has given them of His grace; and they feel pleased with the good news, about those left behind them who could not join them, that there shall be no fear for them nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:171: They feel pleased with blessing from Allah, and grace, and with the fact that Allah would not let the reward of the believers be lost.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:172: Those who responded to the call of Allah and the Messenger, even after they had received the wound, for those of them who did good deeds and feared Allah there is a great reward
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:173: - (that is) those to whom people said, “The people have gathered against you; so, fear them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:174: So, they returned with bounty from Allah, and grace, with no evil having even touched them, and submitted to the pleasure of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:175: It is none but Satan who frightens (you) of his friends.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:176: Those who hasten towards disbelief should not make you grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:177: Certainly, those who bought disbelief in exchange for Belief cannot harm Allah at all.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:178: Those who disbelieve should not think that the respite We give them is good for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:179: Allah is not to leave the believers in the state you are in, unless He separates the impure from the pure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:180: Those who withhold in miserliness what Allah has given them out of His grace should not take it as good for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:181: Allah has surely heard the words of those who said, “Allah is poor, and we are rich.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:182: This is due to what your hands sent ahead and that Allah is not cruel to His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:183: (There are) those who have said, “Allah has directed us that we should not believe in a messenger unless he comes to us with an offering to be eaten up by the fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:184: Then if they reject you, then messengers have been rejected before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:185: Every soul has to taste death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:186: Of course, you shall be tested in your wealth and yourselves; and, of course, you shall hear hurting statements from those who have been given the Book before you, and from those who associate (others with Allah in His divinity).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:187: When Allah took a pledge from those who were given the Book: “You shall make it known to people, and you shall not conceal it,” they threw it away behind their backs, and acquired a small price for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:188: Do not think of those who are delighted with what they did, and love to be praised for what they never did - do not think they are secure from the punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:189: To Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:190: Surely, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for the people of wisdom,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:191: who remember Allah standing and sitting, and (lying) on their sides, and ponder on the creation of the heavens and the earth (and say) “Our Lord, You have not created all this in vain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:192: Our Lord, whomsoever You admit into the Fire, he is disgraced by You indeed, and for the unjust there are no supporters.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:193: Our Lord, We heard a herald calling towards Faith: ‘Believe in your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:194: Our Lord, give us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and do not put us to disgrace on the Day of Judgement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:195: So, their Lord answered their prayer: “I do not allow the labour of any worker from among you, male or female, to go to waste.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:196: The strutting of the disbelievers about the land should not deceive you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:197: It is just a little enjoyment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:198: But those who fear their Lord, for them there are Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will live forever - as hospitality from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:199: Surely, among the people of the Book there are those who believe in Allah, and in what has been sent down to you and what has been sent down to them, humbling themselves before Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:200: O you who believe, be patient, compete with each other in patience, and guard your frontiers and fear Allah, so that you may be successful.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:2: God! There is no god except Him, the Living, the Eternal.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:3: He has revealed to you the Book, by the truth, confirming what was before it, and He revealed the Torah and the Gospel
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:4: before, as guidance to people, and He revealed the Criterion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:5: Nothing whatever is hidden in heaven and earth from God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:6: He it is Who forms you in the wombs as He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:7: He it is Who revealed to you the Book, wherein are verses [that are] clear, forming the Mother Book, and others allegorical.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:8: Our Lord, do not cause our hearts to deviate after You have guided us; and give us mercy from You; You are the Bestower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:9: Our Lord, You shall gather mankind for a day of which there is no doubt; verily God will not fail the tryst.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:10: As for the disbelievers, neither their riches nor their children will avail them against God; those - they shall be fuel for the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:11: As the way of Pharaoh's folk, and the people before them, who denied Our signs; God seized them for their sins; God is severe in retribution.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:12: Say to the disbelievers: 'You shall be vanquished and mustered to Hell - an evil cradling!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:13: There has already been a sign for you in two hosts that met; one company fighting in the way of God; and another unbelieving; they saw them, twice the like of them; for God confirms with His help whom He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:14: Beautified for mankind is love of lusts - of women, children, stored-up heaps of gold and silver, horses of mark, cattle, and tillage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:15: Say: 'Shall I tell you of something better than that? For those that are fearful with their Lord are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein, and spouses purified, and beatitude from God; and God is Seer, of His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:16: Those who say: “O, Our Lord, we believe; so forgive us our sins, and guard us from the chastisement of the Fire”,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:17: the patient, truthful, obedient, expenders, imploring God's pardon at daybreak'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:18: God bears witness that there is no god, except Him, and the angels, and those of knowledge; upholding justice; there is no god except Him, the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:19: Lo!, the religion with God is submission [to the One God].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:20: So if they dispute with you, say: 'I have surrendered my countenance to God and whoever follows me'; and say to those who have been given the Scripture, and to the uninstructed: 'Have you submitted?' And so if they have submitted, they have been guided, but if they turn their backs, your duty is only to deliver; and God sees His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:21: Those who disbelieve in the signs of God and slay the prophets without right, and slay those who enjoin to equity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:22: Those are the ones whose works have failed in this world and the Hereafter; they have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:23: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Book, being called to the Book of God, that it might decide between them, and then a party of them turned away, opposed?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:24: That, because they said, 'the Fire shall not touch us, except for a number of days'; and the lies they used to invent have deluded them in their religion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:25: But how will it be when We gather them for a day of which there is no doubt, and every soul shall be paid in full what is has earned, and they, shall not be wronged?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:26: Say: 'O God, Master of the Kingdom, you give the Kingdom to whom You will, and seize the Kingdom from whom You will; You exalt whom You will, and You abase whom You will; in Your hand is good.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:27: You make the night to pass into the day and You make the day to pass into the night; You bring forth the living from the dead, and You bring forth the dead from the living, and You provide whom You will without reckoning'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:28: Let not the believers take the disbelievers as patrons, rather than the believers - for whoever does that, does not belong to God in anyway - unless you protect yourselves against them, as a safeguard.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:29: Say: 'Whether you hide what is in your breasts, or disclose it, God knows it and knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth; and God is Able to do all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:30: The day every soul shall find what it has done of good present before it, and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between it and that there were a great distance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:31: Say: 'If you love God, follow me, and God will love you, and forgive you your sins; God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:33: Lo! God preferred Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of ‘Imrān above the worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:34: the seed of one another; God is Hearer, Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:35: When the wife of ‘Imrān said, ‘Lord, I have vowed to You what is within my womb as a consecration.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:36: And when she gave birth to her, she said, 'Lord, I have given birth to a female' - and God knew very well what she had given birth to the male is not as the female.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:37: Her Lord accepted the child with gracious acceptance, and made her grow excellently, and Zachariah took charge of her.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:38: Then Zachariah prayed to his Lord, saying, 'Lord, bestow upon me from You a goodly offspring, verily You are the Hearer of supplication'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:39: And the angels called to him, standing in the sanctuary at worship that 'God gives you good tidings of John, who shall confirm a Word from God; a lord, and one chaste, and a prophet of the righteous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:40: He said, 'My Lord! How shall I have a boy when old age has overtaken me, and my wife is barren?' He said, 'So it will be'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:41: He said, 'My Lord! Appoint for me a sign'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:43: And when the angels said, 'O Mary, God has preferred you, and made you pure; He has preferred you above all women of the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:44: O Mary, be obedient to your Lord, prostrating and bowing with those who bow'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:45: That is of the tidings of the Unseen.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:46: When the angels said, 'O Mary, God gives you good tidings of a Word from Him, whose name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, honoured shall he be in this world, and the Hereafter, and of those brought close.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:47: He shall speak to mankind in the cradle, and in his manhood, and he is of the righteous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:48: She said, 'Lord, how shall I have a child when no mortal has touched me?' He said, 'It is such.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:49: And He will teach him the Book, wisdom, and the Torah, and the Gospel.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:50: To be a messenger to the Children of Israel, 'I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, I will create for you out of clay like the shape of a bird then I will breathe into it, and it will be a bird by the leave of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:51: Likewise, confirming that which was before me of the Torah, and to make lawful for you some of that which was forbidden to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:52: Surely God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:53: And when Jesus sensed their disbelief, he said, 'Who will be my helpers unto God?' The disciples said, 'We will be helpers of God; we believe in God; witness that we have submitted.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:54: Lord, we believe in what You have revealed, and we follow the Messenger; inscribe us therefore with those who bear witness’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:55: And they schemed; and God schemed; and God is the best of schemers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:56: When God said, 'O Jesus, I am gathering you, and raising you to Me, and I am cleansing you of those who disbelieved, and I am setting those who follow you above those who disbelieved until the Day of Resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:57: As for the disbelievers, I will chastise them with a terrible chastisement in this world and the Hereafter; they shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:58: But as for the believers, who do deeds of righteous, He will pay them in full their wages.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:59: This We recite to you of verses and wise remembrance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:60: Truly, the likeness of Jesus in God's sight, is as Adam's likeness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:61: The truth is from your Lord; be not of those who waver.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:62: And whoever disputes with you concerning him, after the knowledge that has come to you, say: 'Come! Let us call our sons and your sons, our wives and your wives, our selves and your selves, then let us humbly pray and invoke God's curse upon those who lie'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:64: And if they turn their backs, God knows the agents of corruption.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:65: Say: 'O People of the Scripture! Come now to a word agreed upon between us and you, that we worship none but God and that we do not associate anything with Him, and do not take each other for lords, beside God'; and if they turn their backs, say, 'Bear witness that we have submitted'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:66: O People of the Scripture! Why do you argue about Abraham?, when the Torah was not revealed, neither the Gospel, but, after him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:67: Lo! You are those who dispute about what you know: why do you then dispute concerning that of which you have no knowledge?; and God knows, and you know not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:68: No; Abraham in truth was not a Jew, neither a Christian, but he was a Muslim and a hanīf, and he was never of the idolaters.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:69: Surely the people with the best claim, Abraham, are those who followed him, and this Prophet, and those who believe; and God is the Protector of the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:70: There is a party of the People of the Scripture who yearn to make you go astray; yet they cause none to stray, except themselves; but they are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:71: O People of the Scripture! Why do you disbelieve in God's verses, when you yourselves bear witness?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:72: O People of the Scripture! Why do you confound truth with falsehood, and conceal the truth while you know?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:73: A party of the People of the Scripture say, 'Believe in what has been revealed to those who believe at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it, so that they might then turn back.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:74: And do not believe except in one who follows your religion'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:75: He singles out for His mercy whom He will; God is of bounty abounding'.
