Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:76: And of the People of the Scripture is he who, if you trust him with a hundredweight, he will return it to you; and of them is he who, if you trust him with one dinar, will not return it to you; unless you keep standing over him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:77: Nay, but whoever fulfils his covenant, and has fear, for truly God loves the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:78: Those that sell God's covenant and their own oaths for a small price, there shall be no share for them in the Hereafter; and God shall not speak to them, nor look upon them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them and theirs will be a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:79: And there is a group of them who twist their tongues with the Book, so that you may suppose it as part of the Book; yet it is not part of the Book; and they say, 'It is from God', yet it is not from God, and they speak falsehood against God, while they know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:80: It belongs not to any mortal that God should give him the Book, the Judgement, prophethood, then that he should say to men, 'Be servants to me instead of God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:81: He would never order you to take the angels and the prophets as lords.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:82: And when God made a covenant with the prophets: 'What I have given you of the Book and wisdom; then there shall come to you a messenger confirming what is with you - you shall believe in him and you shall help him'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:83: Then whoever turns his back after that, they are the wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:84: What! Do they desire other than God's religion, when to Him has submitted, whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly, or unwillingly, and to Him they shall be returned?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:85: Say, 'We believe in God, and that which has been revealed to us, and that which has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael, and Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes; and in that which was given to Moses and Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord; we make no division between any of them; and to Him we submit'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:86: Whoever desires a religion other than Islam, it shall not be accepted from him and in the Hereafter he shall be among the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:87: How shall God guide a people who have disbelieved after their belief, and bore witness that the Messenger is true, and after the clear signs had come to them? God guides not the evildoing folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:88: Those - their requital is that there shall rest on them the curse of God and of the angels and of men altogether.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:89: Abiding therein, the chastisement shall not be lightened for them and they shall not be reprieved.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:90: But those who repent thereafter, and make amends, then truly God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:91: Surely those who disbelieve after they have believed, and then increase in unbelief, their repentance shall not be accepted; those are the ones who go astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:92: Surely those who disbelieve, and die disbelieving, the whole earth full of gold shall not be accepted from any one of them if he would ransom himself thereby; for them awaits a painful chastisement, and they shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:93: You will not attain piety until you expend of what you love; and whatever thing you expend, God knows of it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:94: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel save what Israel forbade for himself before the Torah was revealed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:95: Whoever invents falsehood against God after that, those are the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:96: Say: ‘God has spoken the truth, therefore follow the creed of Abraham, a hanīf, and he was not an idolater’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:97: The first house established for the people was that at Bakka, a blessed place, and a guidance to all worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:98: Therein are clear signs, the station of Abraham; and whoever enters it is in security.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:99: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in God's verses, when God is Witness of what you do?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:100: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, why do you bar believers from God's way, desiring to make it crooked, while you yourselves are witnesses.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:101: O you who believe, if you obey a party of those who have been given the Scripture, they will turn you, after you have believed, into disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:102: How can you disbelieve while you have God's verses recited to you, and His Messenger is in your midst? Whoever holds fast to God, he is guided to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:103: O you who believe, fear God as He should be feared; and do not die, except as Muslims.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:104: And hold fast to God's bond, together, and do not scatter; remember God's grace upon you when you were enemies, and He brought your hearts together so that by His grace you became brothers; and you were upon the brink of a pit of fire; but He delivered you from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:105: Let there be one community of you calling to good, and enjoining decency, and forbidding indecency; those are the successful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:106: Be not as those who scattered and disputed after the clear proofs came to them, those there awaits a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:107: The day when some faces are blackened, and some faces whitened.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:108: But as for those whose faces are whitened, they shall be in God's mercy, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:109: Those are the verses of God which We recite to you in truth, and God desires not any injustice for the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:110: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth, and to Him all matters are returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:111: You are the best community brought forth to men, enjoining decency, and forbidding indecency, and believing in God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:112: They will not harm you, except a little hurt; and if they fight against you, they will turn their backs to you, then they will not be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:113: Abasement shall be cast upon them, wherever they are found, save a rope of God, and a rope of the people; they have incurred with anger from God, and poverty shall be cast upon them; that because they disbelieved in God's signs, and slew the prophets without right; that because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:114: Yet they are not all alike; some of the People of the Scripture are a community upright, who recite God's verses in the watches of the night, prostrating themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:115: They believe in God and in the Last Day, enjoining decency and forbidding indecency, vying with one another in good works; those are of the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:116: And whatever good they do, they shall not be denied it, and God knows the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:117: As for the disbelievers, their riches shall not avail them, neither their children, against God; those are the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:118: The likeness of what they expend in the life of this world is as the likeness of a wind wherein is a blast that smote the tillage of a people who have wronged themselves and destroyed it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:119: O you who believe, do not take as intimates anyone apart from yourselves; such men spare nothing to ruin you; they would love for you to suffer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:120: Lo, there you are, you love them, but they love you not; you believe in the Book, all of it, and when they meet you they say, 'We believe', but when they are alone, they bite at you their fingertips, in rage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:121: If good fortune befalls you, it is evil for them; but if evil, befalls you, they rejoice thereat.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:122: And when you went forth at dawn from your family to assign the believers their places for battle, and God hears, knows.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:123: When two parties of you were about to lose heart; and God was their Protector, and let the believers rely on God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:124: God already gave you victory at Badr, when you were contemptible.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:125: When you were saying to the believers, 'Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:126: Yea, if you are patient and fear, and they come against you instantly, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels accoutred'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:127: What God ordained was only as a good tiding to you and that your hearts might be at peace.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:128: And that He might cut off a party of the disbelievers, or suppress them, so that they fall back, frustrated.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:129: It is no concern at all of yours, whether He relents to them or chastises them; for they are indeed evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:130: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; He forgives whom He wills and chastises whom He wills.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:131: O you who believe, do not exact usury, twofold and severalfold.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:132: And fear the Fire that has been prepared for the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:133: And obey God and the Messenger, so that you may find mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:134: And vie with one another hastening to forgiveness from your Lord, and to a garden as wide as the heavens and the earth that has been prepared for those who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:135: Who expend in prosperity and adversity, and restrain their rage, and pardon their fellow-men; and God loves those who are virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:136: And who when they commit an indecency or wrong themselves, remember God, and pray forgiveness for their sins - and who shall forgive sins but God? - and who do not persist in what they did, knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:137: Those - their requital is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein; excellent is the wage of those workers!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:138: Ways of life have passed away before you; so travel in the land and behold how was the end of those who denied.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:139: This is an exposition for mankind, and a guidance, and an admonition for such as are God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:140: Faint not, neither grieve, for you shall prevail if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:141: If a wound touches you, a like wound already has touched the other people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:142: And that God may prove the believers, and efface the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:143: Or did you suppose you should enter Paradise without God knowing, who among you have struggled and who are patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:144: You were longing for death before you met it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:145: Muhammad is only a messenger; messengers have passed away before him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:146: It is not for any soul to die, save by the leave of God, a prescribed term.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:147: How many a prophet has been killed and with him thousands manifold ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:148: but they fainted not in the face of what afflicted them in God's way; they neither weakened, nor did they humble themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:149: All that they said was, 'Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our affairs and make firm our feet and help us against the unbelieving folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:150: And God gave them the reward of this world, and the fairest reward of the Hereafter, and God loves the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:151: O you who believe, if you obey the disbelievers, they will make you turn back on your heels, and you will revert as losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:152: Nay, but God is your Protector, and He is the best of helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:153: We will cast terror into the hearts of the disbelievers; for what they have associated with God that for which He has revealed no warrant; their abode shall be the Fire; evil is the abode of the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:154: God has been true to His promise, when you were slew them by His leave, until you lost heart, and quarrelled over the command; and you disobeyed after He had shown you what you longed for.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:155: When you were ascending, not turning around for anyone and the Messenger was calling you from your rear, so He rewarded you with grief for grief so that you might not grieve for what escaped you, neither for what befell you; and God is aware of what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:156: Then He sent down upon you, after grief, security - a slumber overcoming a party of you, and a party whose own souls distressed them, thinking wrongly of God, thoughts of age of ignorance, saying, ’Have we any part whatever in the affair?’ Say: ’The affair belongs entirely to God’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:157: Truly, those of you who turned away the day the two hosts encountered each other - truly, Satan made them slip through some of what they had earned; but God pardoned them; God is Forgiving, Forbearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:158: O you who believe, be not as the disbelievers, who say of their brothers, when they travel in the land, or are on raiding campaigns, 'Had they been with us, they would not have died and would not have been slain' - so that God may make that anguish in their hearts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:159: And if you are slain in God’s way, or die, forgiveness from God and mercy are better than what they amass.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:160: And if you die or are slain, it is to God you shall be mustered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:161: It was by the mercy of God that you were lenient with them; had you been harsh and fierce of heart, they would have dispersed from about you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:162: If God helps you, then none can overcome you; but if He forsakes you, then who is there who can help you after Him? Therefore on God let the believers rely.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:163: It is not for a prophet to be fraudulent; whoever defrauds shall bring what he has defrauded on the Day of Resurrection; then every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:164: Is he who follows God's beatitude like him who is laden with God's anger, whose abode is Hell? An evil journey's end!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:165: They are of degrees before God; and God sees what they do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:166: Truly God was gracious to the believers when He sent to them a messenger from among their own to recite to them His verses, and to purify them, and to teach them the Book, wisdom, though before, they were in clear error.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:167: And why, when distress befell you, and you had afflicted twice the like of it, did you say, 'How is this?' Say: 'It is from yourselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:168: And what afflicted you, the day the two hosts encountered, was by God's leave, and that He might know the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:169: And that He might also know the hypocrites when it was said to them, 'Come now, fight in the way of God or defend', they said, 'If we knew how to fight we would follow you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:170: Those who said to their brothers, whilst they themselves stayed put, 'Had they obeyed us, they would not have been slain'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:171: Count not those who were slain in God's way, as dead, but rather, living with their Lord, provided for [by Him].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:172: Rejoicing in what God has given them of His bounty, and rejoicing, for the sake of those who have not joined them but are left behind, that no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:173: Joyful in grace and bounty from God, and that God does not let the wage of believers go to waste.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:175: those who responded to God and the Messenger after the wounds had afflicted them, and feared, shall be a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:176: Those to whom people said, 'The people have gathered against you, therefore fear them'; but that increased them in faith, and they said, 'God is sufficient for us, an excellent Guardian is He'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:177: So they returned with grace and bounty from God, and no evil touched them, and they followed the beatitude of God; and God is of bounty abounding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:178: That is only Satan making fear his friends, therefore do not fear them; but fear Me, if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:179: Let them not grieve you those that vie with one another in unbelief; they will not hurt God at all.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:180: Those who purchase unbelief at the price of faith, they will not hurt God at all, and there awaits them a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:181: And let not the disbelievers suppose that what We indulge them in is better for their souls.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:182: It is not God's purpose to leave the believers in the state in which you are till He shall distinguish the evil one from the good.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:183: Let them not suppose those who are niggardly with what God has given them of His bounty, that it is better for them; nay, it is worse for them; what they were niggardly with, they shall have hung around their necks on the Day of Resurrection; and to God belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:184: Verily God has heard the saying of those who said, 'Indeed God is poor, and we are rich'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:185: That is for what your hands have sent before; for God is never unjust towards His servants'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:186: Those same who said, 'God has already made covenant with us that we should not believe in any messenger until he bring us an offering to be devoured by fire': 'messengers have come to you before me with clear proofs, and with that which you said.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:187: But if they deny you, so were denied messengers before you who came bearing clear proofs, and the Scriptures, and the Illuminating Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:188: Every soul shall taste of death; you shall surely be paid in full your wages on the Day of Resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:189: You shall surely be tried in your property; and in your selves, and you shall hear from those who were given the Scripture before you, and from those who are idolaters, much hurt, but if you are patient, and fear - surely that is true resolve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:190: And when God made covenant with those who had been given the Scripture, 'You shall expound it to people, and not conceal it'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:191: Do not reckon that those who rejoice in what they have brought, and who love to be praised for what they have not done - do not reckon them secure from the chastisement; there shall be a painful chastisement for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:192: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:193: Surely in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:194: Those who remember God, standing and sitting and on their sides, and reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: 'Our Lord, You have not created this in vain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:195: Our Lord, whomever You admit into the Fire, You will have abased, and the evildoers shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:196: Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling to belief, saying, "Believe in your Lord!" And we believed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:197: Our Lord, grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and abase us not on the Day of Resurrection.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:198: And their Lord answers them, ’I do not let the labour of any labourer among you go to waste, be you male or female - the one of you is as the other: and those who emigrated, and were expelled from their habitations, those who suffered hurt in My way, and fought, and were slain - them I shall surely absolve of their evil deeds, and I shall admit them to Gardens underneath which river flow’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:199: Let it not delude you, that the disbelievers go to and fro in the land,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:200: a little enjoyment; then their abode is Hell - an evil cradling!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:201: But those who fear their Lord - for them shall be Gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein; a hospitality from God Himself.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:202: Verily, there are some among the People of the Scripture who believe in God, and what has been revealed to you, and what has been revealed to them, humble before God, not purchasing with the verses of God a small price.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:203: O you who believe, be patient and vie in patience, be steadfast; fear God so that you will prosper.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:2: Allah! None is worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, Self-Subsisting and Sustainer (of the entire universe with His Strategy).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:3: (O Beloved!) He is the One Who has revealed to you (this) Book with truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:4: (As the Books were revealed) before this to guide the people, He has (now, in like manner,) revealed (the Qur’an,) the criterion to distinguish right from wrong.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:5: Surely, nothing is hidden from Allah in the earth or in the heaven.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:6: He is the One Who shapes your forms the way He wills in the wombs (of mothers).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:7: He is the One Who has revealed to you the Book comprising some firm and solid Verses (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:8: (And they submit:) ‘O our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have honoured us with guidance, and grant us mercy especially from Your presence.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:9: O our Lord! You will surely bring together mankind on the Day about which there is no doubt.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:10: Indeed, those who reject faith, neither their wealth nor their children shall be able to save them anyway from (the torment of) Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:11: (Their) line of action (also) resembles that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them who belied Our Revelations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:12: Say to the disbelievers: ‘You will soon be overpowered and driven towards Hell, and that is a very evil abode.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:13: There is certainly a sign for you in the two parties that encountered each other (in the battlefield of Badr)—one party (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:14: (Excessively) attractive has been made, for the people, the love of lusts (that) include women, children, and hoarded treasures of gold and silver, and branded horses and cattle and crops.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:15: (O Beloved!) Say: ‘Shall I give you the news of something far better than all this? (Yes,) for the Godfearing there are (such) Gardens with their Lord beneath which streams flow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:16: (These are the people) who say: ‘O our Lord, we have surely believed, so, forgive us our sins and save us from the torment of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:17: (They are) steadfast (people), truthful in their words and deeds and submissive in devotion and obedience.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:18: Allah bears witness that none is worthy of worship apart from Him; and the angels and those who possess knowledge also bear testimony to it (as well as the fact) that He designs and executes every plan with justice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:19: Truly, Islam is the only Din (Religion) in Allah’s sight.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:20: (O Beloved!) If they, even then, dispute with you, say to them: ‘I have bowed my humble face in absolute submissiveness before the presence of Allah and so have those who follow me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:21: Certainly, those who deny the Revelations of Allah and kill the Prophets unjustly, and also kill those of the people who enjoin equity and justice, announce to them the news of a grievous torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:22: They are the ones whose works have become void both in this world and in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:23: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of (the knowledge of) the Book? They are invited towards the Book of Allah, so that it (the Book) gives judgment (on disputes) amongst them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:24: This (courage to deviate) is because they say: ‘The Fire of Hell will not touch us except for a few numbered days.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:25: So, what will be their plight when We shall assemble all of them together on the Day in (the happening of) which there is no doubt, and everyone will be paid back in full for whatever (deeds) he has earned, and no injustice will be done to them?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:26: (O My Beloved!) Submit (like this): ‘O Allah, Lord of sovereignty! You bestow sovereignty on whom You will, and You take away sovereignty from whom You will.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:27: You make the night enter into the day, and You make the day enter into the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living; and You bless (with Your bounties) without measure whom You wish.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:28: The Muslims should not make friends with disbelievers instead of Muslims.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:29: Say: ‘Whether you hide what is in your breasts or make it known, Allah knows it, and He thoroughly knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:30: On the Day when every soul shall find present (before him) every good that he accomplished and every evil that he perpetrated, he will wish there were a great distance between him and that evil (or that Day).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:31: (O Beloved!) Say: ‘If you love Allah, follow me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:32: Say: ‘Obey Allah and the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:33: Verily, Allah chose Adam, and Nuh (Noah), and the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the family of ‘Imran (in dignity) above all the people of the world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:34: They are all one race, descendants of one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:35: And (recall) when the wife of ‘Imran said: ‘O my Lord, I vow purely to You what is in my womb, freeing him (from other obligations).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:36: So when she delivered a baby girl, she submitted: ‘Lord, I have given birth but to a female child.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:37: So, her Lord graciously accepted her (Maryam )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:38: with excellent acceptance and brought her up immaculately and entrusted her guardianship to Zakariyya (Zacharias).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:39: At the same place, Zakariyya (Zacharias) supplicated his Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:40: Whilst he was still standing in the chamber offering the Prayer (or supplicating), the angels called out to him: ‘Indeed, Allah gives you the good news of (a son) Yahya (John), who shall confirm Allah’s Word (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:41: and he will be a leader, well-protected against (temptation for) women, and a Prophet from amongst (Our) exceptionally pious servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:43: submitted: ‘O my Lord, how shall I have a son when old age has already overtaken me, and my wife is (also) barren?’ He said: ‘The same way as Allah does whatever He wills.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:44: Zakariyya (Zacharias) submitted: ‘O my Lord, fix a sign for me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:45: And (remember) when the angels said: ‘O Maryam (Mary), surely Allah has chosen you and has blessed you with purity and has exalted you today over all the women of the world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:46: O Maryam (Mary)! Obey your Lord consistently with utmost humbleness, prostrate yourself, and bow down in worship along with those who bow down.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:47: (O Beloved!) These are the tidings of the unseen which We reveal to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:48: When the angels said: ‘O Maryam (Mary), surely, Allah gives you glad tidings of a (particular) Word from Him named the Messiah, ‘Isa, the son of Maryam (Jesus, the son of Mary), who would be eminent and exalted, (both) in this world and in the Hereafter, and would be of those who are exceptionally intimate servants of Allah blessed with His nearness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:49: And he will talk to the people (alike) both in the cradle and in ripe years, and he will be one of the most pious servants (of Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:50: Maryam (Mary) submitted: ‘O my Lord, how shall I have a son when no man has ever touched me?’ He said: ‘Just as Allah creates what He pleases.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:51: And Allah will teach him the Book and the wisdom, the Torah and the Injil ([the Gospel] everything).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:52: And he will be a Messenger to the Children of Israel, (saying to them:) ‘I have undoubtedly brought to you a sign from your Lord: I design for you from clay (a figure) like the shape of a bird; then I breathe into it; and at once it becomes a flying bird by Allah’s command.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:53: And I validate the (Book) Torah sent down before me, and that is because I may declare certain things lawful for you which were forbidden to you as unlawful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:54: Verily, Allah is my Lord and your Lord too.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:55: Later, when ‘Isa (Jesus) sensed their disbelief, he said: ‘Who are my helpers in the way of Allah?’ His sincere companions submitted: ‘We are the helpers of (the Din
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:57: O our Lord! We have believed in the Book which You have sent down, and we have become the followers of this Messenger.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:58: Then, the disbelieving (Jews) conspired secretly (to execute ‘Isa ),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:59: but Allah covertly designed His plan (to safeguard ‘Isa ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:60: And Allah is the Best of secret planners.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:61: When Allah said: ‘O ‘Isa (Jesus), I will surely bring your term of life to completion; and I am about to lift you towards Myself (in the heavens), and deliver you from the disbelievers, and exalt your followers above (these) disbelievers till the Day of Resurrection.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:62: As for those who disbelieved, I shall give them severe punishment (both) in this world and in the Hereafter, and they shall have no helpers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:63: And those who believed and did pious deeds, (Allah) shall reward them in full.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:64: These which We read out to you are signs and the wisdom-laden advice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:65: Surely, the example of ‘Isa (Jesus) in the sight of Allah is the same as that of Adam whom He formed from clay, then said (to him): ‘Be.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:66: (Ordained to forewarn the Umma [the Community]:) ‘This is the truth from your Lord, so be not of those who doubt.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:67: So, if someone contends with you about ‘Isa (Jesus) after knowledge has come to you, say: ‘Come, let us (jointly) call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, and ourselves and yourselves (at the same place).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:68: Most certainly, this is the true narrative, and there is none worthy of worship except Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:69: But if they turn away, then surely Allah knows the miscreants full well.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:70: Say: ‘O People of the Book, come to that matter which is common between us and you (namely that): we shall worship none other than Allah, and we shall not associate any partner with Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:71: O People of the Book! Why do you dispute about Ibrahim (
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:73: Listen! You are the people who have also been disputing about matters of which you had (but some) knowledge.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:74: Ibrahim (Abraham) was neither a Jew nor a Christian; he was a (true) Muslim, far detached from all heresy and falsehood.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:75: Certainly, the nearest of the people to Ibrahim (Abraham), (and the most deserving) are those who have followed him (in his Din ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:76: And (they) are no other than this Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and those who have believed (in him).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:77: (O Muslims!) A section of the People of the Book (intensely) desire to, somehow, lead you astray, but they have led astray only themselves whilst they have no sense (of it).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:78: O People of the Book! Why are you denying Allah’s Revelations whilst you bear witness yourselves (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:79: O People of the Book! Why do you confound the truth with falsehood, and why do you hide the truth whereas you know?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:80: And a section of the People of the Book say (to the people): ‘Believe in the Book (Qur’an) which is sent down to Muslims in the morning, and deny it in the evening, so that (imitating you) they may also desert and turn about.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:81: And do not believe anyone but him who follows (only) your din (religion).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:82: given to you may also be given to anyone else, or that someone may give a plea against you before your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:83: He specifies His mercy for whom He wills and Allah is the Lord of Infinite Bounty.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:84: And amongst the People of the Book there are a type that if you trust him with a heap of wealth, he will return it to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:85: Yes, he who fulfils his promise and adopts Godfearingness (will indeed face no accountability); so Allah surely loves the pious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:86: Certainly, those who sell the promise of Allah and their own oaths for a small price, it is they who will not have any share in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:87: And there is indeed another section of them who, whilst reciting the Book, twist their tongues so that you may take their inverted expression as (part of) the Book, whereas it is not from the Book.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:88: No human being whom Allah blesses with the Book and Wisdom and Prophethood has the right to say to the people: ‘Be my servants instead of Allah’s.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:89: Nor would that Messenger ever command you to take the angels and the Prophets as Lords.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:90: And, (O Beloved, recall) when Allah took a firm covenant from the Prophets: ‘When I give you the Book and Wisdom, and then there comes to you the Messenger (who is exalted in glory above all and) who shall validate the Books you will have with you, you shall then, most certainly, believe in him and most surely help him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:91: (Now admonished all mankind:) ‘Then he who turns away after this (affirmation), it is they who will be the disobedient.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:92: Do they seek some din (religion) other than Allah’s? And whoever is in the heavens and the earth has embraced His obedience (whether) by choice or by constraint, and to Him shall they all be returned.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:93: Say: ‘We believe in Allah and in that which has been sent down to us and in that which has been revealed to Ibrahim (Abraham), Isma‘il (Ishmael), Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya‘qub (Jacob) and their descendants and that which has been given to Musa (Moses), ‘Isa (Jesus) and all other Messengers by their Lord (we believe in all).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:94: And whoever seeks a din (religion) other than Islam that shall not at all be accepted from him, and he will be amongst the losers in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:95: How shall Allah guide those who disbelieved after embracing faith whilst they had borne witness that this Messenger is true, and clear signs too had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:96: The punishment of such people is that they are continually plagued by the curse of Allah, of the angels and of all mankind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:97: They shall remain (imprisoned) under this curse forever.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:98: Except those who repent and mend (their) ways.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:99: Assuredly, the people who disbelieve after accepting belief and then advance in disbelief, their repentance will not be accepted at all, and it is they who have lost the right path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:100: Surely, those who disbelieved and died whilst they were disbelievers, if any of them offers an earthful of gold as ransom (for his salvation), that shall not be accepted from him at all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:101: You can never attain to piety unless you spend (in the cause of Allah) out of that which you like the most; and Allah surely knows well whatever you give away.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:102: Before the revelation of the Torah, everything edible was lawful for the Children of Israel except those (things) Ya‘qub (Jacob) had declared forbidden for himself.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:103: So, whoever fabricates a lie against Allah even after this, then it is they who are the wrongdoers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:104: Say: ‘Allah has proclaimed the truth, so follow the Din (Religion) of Ibrahim (Abraham) who, rejecting every evil, devoted himself wholly to Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:105: The first House ever constructed for mankind (to worship Allah) is indeed the one in Mecca, teeming with blessings and (the centre of) guidance for the whole world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:106: There are manifest signs in it, (one of which is) the station of Ibrahim (Abraham).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:107: Say: ‘O People of the Book, why do you deny the Revelations of Allah? And Allah is observing your actions.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:108: Say: ‘O People of the Book, why do you hinder the one who has embraced faith from Allah’s path? You want to make their path crooked too, whilst you yourselves are witnesses (that it is straight).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:109: O believers! If you obey any section of the People of the Book, they will turn you back to disbelief after you have (embraced) faith.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:110: And how will you disbelieve (now), whilst you are (fortunate) ones to whom the Verses of Allah are recited, and the Messenger of Allah (blessings and peace be upon him) is (himself) present amongst you? And whoever holds fast to (the Embrace of) Allah is most surely guided to the straight path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:111: O believers! Fear Allah as it is due to fear Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:112: And hold fast to the rope of Allah, all of you together, and do not generate dissension and factions.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:113: And from amongst you there must be a community comprising the people who invite mankind towards piety, enjoin righteousness and forbid evil.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:114: And become not like those who split into sects and dissented even after manifest signs had reached them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:115: On the Day when many faces will be bright and many others will be dark, the ones with dark faces (will be asked): ‘Did you reject faith after you had believed? So taste the torment for the disbelief you had been committing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:116: But those with (glittering) white faces will be in Allah’s mercy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:117: These are the Revelations of Allah which We recite to you with truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:118: And whatever exists in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:119: You are the best community brought forth for (the guidance of) mankind: you enjoin righteousness, forbid evil and believe in Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:120: They cannot do you any harm beyond offending; and if they fight you, they will turn their backs upon you; then they will not be helped (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:121: They are shut in humiliation wherever they may be found, except that they are (provided with shelter) under some promise with Allah or some bond with people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:123: They believe in Allah and the Last Day and enjoin righteousness, and forbid evil, and they race to pious works.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:124: And whatever pious acts they do will not be disregarded; and Allah is Well Aware of those who guard against evil.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:125: Certainly, those who have disbelieved, neither their riches nor their children will provide them any protection against (the torment of) Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:126: (Whatever) wealth (these people) spend in the life of this world is like the frost-laden wind which strikes and destroys the harvest of a people who wrong their own souls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:127: O believers! Do not confide in those who are not from amongst you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:128: Beware! You are the ones who love them, but they do not (even) like you, although you believe in all the Books.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:129: If something goes in your favour, it grieves them; but if some pain afflicts you, that pleases them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:130: And (recall the time) when, early morning, you left your blessed abode (on the eve of the battle of Uhud), and were positioning the Muslims at their posts for the battle (in defence against the aggression by Meccan invaders).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:131: (Recall) when two groups from amongst you (Banu Salama Khazraj and Banu Haritha Aws) intended cowardliness although Allah was their ally.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:132: And Allah provided you help in the battle of Badr, whereas you had little resources (at that time).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:133: When you said to the believers: ‘Is it not enough for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent-down?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:134: Yes, if you remain steadfast and persist in Godwariness, and these (unbelievers) suddenly attack you with (full) force, then your Lord will come to your aid with five thousand angels distinctly marked.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:135: And Allah has made this (reinforcement) a glad tidings for you so that it may content your hearts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:136: (Also) because (Allah) may exterminate a section of the unbelievers or abase them so that they go back defeated.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:137: (O Beloved! Now) this matter is not your concern, whether Allah enables them to repent or torments them, because they are the transgressors.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:138: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth belongs to Allah alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:139: O believers! Do not live on usury doubled and redoubled, and keep fearing Allah so that you may prosper.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:140: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for those who reject faith.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:141: And persist in obedience to Allah and the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) so that you may be blessed with mercy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:142: And advance fast towards forgiveness from your Lord and Paradise whose vastness encompasses the heavens and the earth (and) which has been prepared for the pious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:143: They are the ones who spend in the cause of Allah whether they are affluent or indigent (in both the conditions), sublimate their anger and tolerate (the faults of the) people; and Allah loves those who are benevolent.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:144: And (they) are such people that if they commit some immoral act or wrong themselves, they remember Allah, then seek forgiveness for their sins.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:145: It is they whose reward is forgiveness from their Lord and Gardens beneath which rivers flow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:146: Before you many codes (of divine law) have passed (for the preceding nations).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:147: This Qur’an is an exposition for mankind and guidance and counsel for those who fear Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:148: And do not lose heart or feel grieved; and it is you who will be victorious, provided you maintain (perfect) faith.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:149: If you have received a blow (now, then remember that) they too have received a similar blow already.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:150: And this is (also) with the intention that Allah may bring (more) refinement to the believers (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:151: Do you assume that you will enter Paradise (without any good), whereas Allah has not yet tested those of you who fight for His cause, nor has He judged the steadfast?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:152: And you used to long for death (as a martyr) before you faced it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:153: And Muhammad (blessings and peace be upon him) is but a Messenger (and not God).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:154: of Islam or his Messengership is false)? And whoever turns back on his heels shall not harm Allah the least.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:155: And no one can die without Allah’s command.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:156: And how many Prophets have there been who fought in the cause of Allah! A large number of devotees of Allah (Awliya’) also joined them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:157: And they said nothing except this supplication: ‘O our Lord, forgive our sins and overlook the excesses that we committed in our work, and keep us firm-footed (on Your path), and bestow upon us victory over the disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:158: So, Allah paid them the reward of this world and also an excellent recompense in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:159: O believers! If you obey the disbelievers, they will turn you back on your heels (to disbelief) and you will then turn back as losers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:160: Nay, Allah is your Mawla (Helper and Guardian) and He is the best of helpers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:161: Soon shall We plant (your) awesomeness into the hearts of disbelievers because they have associated with Allah partners for which He has not sent down any authority.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:162: Surely, Allah fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing them by His command until you showed cowardice and you started disputing about the command (of the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him]) and later disobeyed (him), whereas Allah had brought that victory in your sight which you coveted.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:163: When you were running away (in panic) and did not look back at anyone, and the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) was calling you out (standing) amongst the party that were (steadfast) in your rear.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:164: Then after grief He sent down on you calm (and peace for relief) in the form of a slumber that overtook a party of you, whilst another party (comprising hypocrites who) were only worried about their own souls indulged in false assumptions about Allah which were (just) the assumptions of ignorance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:165: Certainly, those of you who fled on that day when the two armies engaged in fierce fighting were only caused by Satan to slip, owing to some act they had perpetrated.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:166: O believers! Be not like the infidels who say of those of their brothers who go (somewhere) on a journey or go to fight (and die there): ‘Had they stayed with us, they would have neither died nor been slain,’ so that Allah may make this (assumption) a regret in their hearts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:167: And if you are slain in the cause of Allah or die, Allah’s forgiveness and mercy is far better than that (wealth) which you accumulate.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:168: And if you die or are slain, you will (all) be brought together before Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:169: (O My Esteemed Beloved!) What a mercy of Allah that you are lenient with them! Had you been stern and hard-hearted, people would have deserted, scattering away from around you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:170: If Allah helps you, none can overpower you; but if He abandons you taking away all support, then who is it that can help you after Him? And the believers should rely on Allah alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:171: It is just not conceivable that any Prophet would conceal anything.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:172: How can a person who has subjected himself to the will of Allah be like the one who has earned Allah’s wrath? And Hell is his abode, and that is an extremely evil dwelling.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:173: They have varying grades in the sight of Allah and Allah thoroughly observes their acts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:174: Indeed, Allah conferred a great favour on the believers that He raised amongst them (the most eminent) Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) from amongst themselves, who recites to them His Revelations, purifies them, and educates them on the Book and Wisdom though, before that, they were in manifest error.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:175: Is it not that when disaster seized you, whilst you had inflicted twice as much (on your enemy), you said: ‘Whence has it befallen’? Say: ‘It is from your own selves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:176: And the agony that hurt you on the day when the two armies clashed with each other came about (only) by Allah’s command.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:177: And (He) also distinguishes the identity of those who are hypocrites.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:178: (They) are the ones who said about their brothers, whilst they themselves stayed back (home): ‘Had they accepted our counsel, they would not have been slain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:179: And do not (ever) think that those who are slain in the way of Allah are dead.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:180: They rejoice in these (blessings of eternal life) that Allah has conferred on them of His bounty, and they also feel pleased (on finding) their successors (on the path of faith and obedience) who have not (yet) joined them, for they shall also have neither any fear nor any grief.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:181: They are filled with joy owing to the blessing (of divine disclosures of the nearness) of Allah and His bounty (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:182: Those who submitted to the command of Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) even after sustaining injuries—for those of them who possess spiritual excellence and are God-fearing, there is an immense reward.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:183: They are the ones whom people said: ‘The adversaries have gathered (in great number) against you, so fear them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:184: Then they (the Muslims) returned with the bounties and blessings of Allah, untouched by any suffering.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:185: Surely, this (informer) is Satan alone who threatens (you) through his friends.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:186: (O sympathizer of the whole mankind!) Those who hasten in (reinforcing) disbelief should not aggrieve you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:187: of) Allah, and Allah intends that there is no share for them in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:188: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief at the cost of belief cannot harm Allah the least, and for them there is a grievous chastisement.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:189: And the disbelievers must never assume that the respite We are providing them is of any good to their souls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:190: And Allah will never leave the Muslims in the situation you are in (now) until He distinguishes the impure from the pure.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:191: And those who are niggardly in giving away (from the wealth) which Allah has bestowed upon them out of His bounty must never consider this miserliness of any benefit to themselves; it is rather injurious to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:192: Allah has surely heard the remarks of those who say: ‘Allah is indigent and we are rich.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:193: This is the recompense of your deeds that your hands have forwarded ahead, and indeed Allah does not do injustice to servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:194: The people (Jews) who say (as a justification): ‘Allah sent us the command not to put faith in any Messenger unless he (to prove his Messengership) brings us an offering that the fire will devour.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:195: If, even then, they belie you, (My Beloved, do not be aggrieved).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:196: Every soul is going to taste death.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:197: (O believers!) You will most certainly be tested in your possessions and your selves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:198: And (remember) when Allah took a firm promise from those who were given the Book: ‘You shall communicate it clearly and plainly to the people and shall not hide (whatever is described in it),’ they cast this promise behind their backs and sold it for a paltry price.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:199: Never regard those (as the emancipated ones) who rejoice over their crooked works and want to be praised for the deeds that they have never done.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:200: The sovereignty of all the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone and Allah has perfect control over everything.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:201: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, there are signs (of Allah’s absolute authority) for those who possess constructive wisdom.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:202: These are the people who, remembering Allah, remain standing (as the epitome of submissiveness), sitting (as reverence incarnate), and (also keep) changing sides (in discomfort of love) and meditate on (the manifest lustre of His Eminence and Beauty at work in) the creation of the heavens and the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:203: O our Lord! Indeed, whomever You admit to Hell, You have surely humiliated him, and the wrongdoers do not have any supporters.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:204: O our Lord! (We were oblivious of You,) then we heard a Caller, calling towards faith: ‘(O people,) believe in your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:205: O our Lord! Grant us all that You have promised us through Your Messengers, and do not humiliate us on the Day of Resurrection.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:206: Then their Lord accorded approval to their supplication (and said:) ‘Certainly, I do not waste the wages of any labourer, whether man or woman; you all are from one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:207: (O servant of Allah!) The roaming about of the disbelievers in the cities (with luxurious riches) should not cause you any illusion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:208: This is an insignificant possession (for a brief period).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:209: But those who persist in fearing their Lord, for them there are Gardens beneath which rivers flow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:210: And indeed, some People of the Book are such that they believe in Allah, and also (have faith in) the Book that has been revealed to you, and the one which was sent down to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:211: O believers! Be steadfast and, in perseverance (and tenacity), toil (even harder than the enemy) and be alert and vigilant (for struggle against violation of peace and human rights), and (always) persist in fearing Allah so that you may achieve success.

null.verse 3:2: Ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Jumala, iäti elävä, kaikki ylläpitävä.
null.verse 3:3: Hän on ylhäältä antanut sinulle, Muhammed, Pyhä kirjan, joka on totuus, vahvistaakseen mitä on ollut ennen sitä; aikaisemmin Hän on lähettänyt Lain ja Evankeliumin opastukseksi ihmisille ja antanut Johdatuksen,jotta he hylkäisivät pahan ja valitsisivat hyvän.
null.verse 3:4: Jumalalta ei ole mitään salattua maan päällä eikä taivaassa.
null.verse 3:5: Hän muovaa teidät äidin kohdussa tahtonsa mukaan.
null.verse 3:6: Hän on sinulle, Muhammed, antanut Pyhän kirjan; se sisältää selviä ilmoituksia, joilla on vain yksi merkitys - ne muodostavat Kirjan perustan - ja toisia, jotka ovat vertauskuvallisia.
null.verse 3:7: Herra, älä salli sydämemme eksyä totuudesta, senjälkeen kuin olet antanut meille Opastuksesi, vaan suo meille laupeutesi! Sinä yksin olet totisesti kaiken Antaja.
null.verse 3:8: Sinä, Herramme, olet totisesti kokoava ihmiset päivänä, josta ei ole epäilystäkään; katso, Jumala ei petä lupaustansa.
null.verse 3:9: (Sinä päivänä) eivät hyödytä vähääkään uskottomia heidän rikkautensa eivätkä heidän lapsensa Jumalan edessä; he joutuvat Tulen omiksi.
null.verse 3:10: Niinpä oli faraon kansankin laita ja niiden, jotka ennen heitä pitivät Meidän tunnusmerkkejämme vaiheena.
null.verse 3:11: Sano niille, jotka ovat uskottomia: »Te joudutte tappiolle ja teidät karkoitetaan Helvettiin».
null.verse 3:12: Olihan teille jo tunnusmerkkinä kaksi sotajoukkoa, jotka kohtasivat toisensa , toinen taisteli Jumalan asian puolesta, toinen oli uskoton.
null.verse 3:13: Ihmiset etsivät nautintoa naisista, lapsista, kootuista kulta ja hopea-aarteista, parhaina pidetyistä hevosista, karjasta ja pelloista; nämä ovat vain maallisen elämän nautintoja, mutta Jumalan luona tulee olemaan ihanin asunto.
null.verse 3:14: Sano: »Onko minun ilmoitettava teille jotakin parempaa kuin tämä?» Ne jotka pelkäävät Jumalaa, löytävät Herransa luona ikiviihtyisät puutarhat, joissa virrat vyöryvät, heitä odot~ tavat siellä puhtaat puolisot ja Jumalan mielisuosio.
null.verse 3:15: jotka sanovat: » Herra, me uskomme totisesti; anna anteeksi meille syntimme ja varjele meitä Tulen tuskilta», .
null.verse 3:16: jotka ovat kärsivällisiä, totuudellisia, hurskaita, vieraanvaraisia, jotka aamuhämärissä rukoilevat syntejään anteeksi.
null.verse 3:17: Jumala todistaa, ettei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän.
null.verse 3:18: Oikea uskonto Jumalan edessä on Islaam.
null.verse 3:19: ja jos he kiistelevät kanssasi, niin sano: »Minä olen kokonaan alistunut Jumalan tahtoon, samoin nekin, jotka seuraavat minua».
null.verse 3:20: Niille, jotka eivät usko Jumalan tunnusmerkkeihin ja jotka ilman syytä surmaavat profeetat sekä oikeamielisyyttä harrastavat ihmiset, tulee sinun julistaa sanomaa tuskallisesta rangaistuksesta.
null.verse 3:21: He ovat niitä, joiden työt raukeavat tyhjiin sekä tässä että tulevassa elämässä, eikä heillä tule olemaan puoltajaa.
null.verse 3:22: Etkö nähnyt, kuinka ne jotka ovat saaneet osan Pyhästä kirjasta , kiistellessään vetoavat Jumalan Kirjaan, jotta se ratkaisisi heidän riitansa, ja kuinka jotkut heistä kääntyvät pois siitä.
null.verse 3:23: ja tämä tapahtuu siksi, että he sanovat: »Ei tuli meitä ahdista kuin joinakuina päivinä », ja heidän itse keksimänsä ajatukset pettävät heidät heidän uskossaan.
null.verse 3:24: Ja kuinka heidän käykään, kun Me kokoamme heidät sinä päivänä, josta ei ole epäilystäkään ja jolloin jokainen sielu saa täyden palkan ansionsa mukaan, eikä ketään väärin tuomita?
null.verse 3:25: Sano: »Oi Jumala, valtakuntain Valtias, Sinä annat valtakunnan kenelle tahdot ja otat sen pois keneltä tahdot, Sinä korotat kenet tahdot ja alennat kenet tahdot.
null.verse 3:26: Sinä annat yön seurata päivää ja päivän seurata yötä, Sinä saat elävän versomaan kuolleesta ja teet kuolleen elävästä, ja Sinä annat elatuksen kenelle tahdot, määrää panematta.
null.verse 3:27: Uskovaiset älkööt ottako uskottomia ystävikseen uskovaisten asemesta.
null.verse 3:28: »Salaattepa te, mitä teillä on sydämessänne, tai ilmaisette sen, Jumala sen kuitenkin tietää.
null.verse 3:29: Sinä päivänä, jolloin jokainen sielu löytää edestään sen, mitä hyvää on tehnyt, ja samoin sen, mitä pahaa on tehnyt, hän on toivova, että olisi syvä kuilu hänen ja hänen pahojen tekojensa välillä.
null.verse 3:30: Sano: »Jos te rakastatte Jumalaa, niin seuratkaa minua, ja Jumala on rakastava teitä ja antava anteeksi teille syntinne, sillä Jumala on sääliväinen ja laupias».
null.verse 3:31: Sano: »Totelkaa Jumalaa ja profeettaa! Sillä jos käännytte pois, niin tietäkää, että Jumala totisesti ei rakasta uskottomia.
null.verse 3:32: Katso, Jumala on yli kaikkien kansojen valinnut Aadamin ja Nooan, Aabrahamin suvun ja Imraanin suvun
null.verse 3:33: toinen toisensa jälkeläisinä, koska toinen polveutuu toisesta.
null.verse 3:34: Entä kun Imraanin vaimo sanoi: »Herra, minä olen Sinulle luvannut ja kokonaan pyhittänyt, minkä kohdussani kannan; ota se siis vastaan minulta.
null.verse 3:35: Ja kun hän oli synnyttänyt, sanoi hän: »Herra, katso, olen synnyttänyt tyttölapsen» - ja Jumalahan tiesi parhaiten, minkä hän oli synnyttänyt, sillä miespuolinen ei ole sama kuin naispuolinen lapsi - »ja olen antanut hänelle nimen Maria ja minä asetan hänet ja hänen jälkeläisensä Sinun suojelukseesi, varjele heitä kirotulta Saatanalta».
null.verse 3:36: Niin vastaanotti hänen Herransa hänet (Marian) suosiollisesti ja antoi hänen kasvaa ihanasti, uskoen hänet Sakarian huostaan; ja joka kerta kun Sakaria astui hänen luokseen pyhäkköön, havaitsi hän ruokaa hänen edessään ja sanoi: »Maria, mistä tämä tulee sinulle?» Hän vastasi: »Se tulee Jumalalta; Jumala huolehtii kenestä tahtoo, määrää panematta».
null.verse 3:37: Siellä rukoili Sakaria Herraansa.
null.verse 3:38: ja niin huusivat enkelit hänelle sinne, missä hän seisoi pyhäkössä rukoilemassa: »Jumala iloksesi ilmoittaa sinulle (syntyvän) Johanneksen, josta tulee Jumalan totisen sanan vahvistaja, suuri, pidättyväinen ja vanhurskas profeetta».
null.verse 3:39: Ja Sakaria sanoi: »Herra, kuinka minä voin saada pojan, kun vanhuus on jo saavuttanut minut ja vaimoni on hedelmätön?» Enkeli vastasi: »Olkoonpa niinkin, Jumala tekee tahtonsa mukaan.
null.verse 3:40: Silloin hän sanoi: »Herra, anna minulle tunnusmerkki!» Hän vastasi: »Sinun tunnusmerkkisi olkoon, ettet voi kolmeen vuorokauteen puhua ihmisille muuten kuin viittomalla.
null.verse 3:41: Ja katso, enkelit sanoivat: »Maria, Jumala on totisesti valinnut, puhdistanut ja pyhittänyt sinut; Hän on korottanut sinut koko luomakunnan naisten yli.
null.verse 3:42: Maria, ole hurskas Herrasi palvelija, heittäydy maahan ja kumarra niiden kanssa, jotka Häntä kumartavat.
null.verse 3:43: Tämä on, Muhammed, ilmoitus salatuista asioista, ja sinulle Me sen ilmaisemme, sillä sinä et ollut heidän kanssaan, kun he kirjoituspuikoillaan heittivät arpaa siitä, kuka saisi huolehdittavaksensa Marian, etkä sinä ollut myöhemminkään heidän joukossaan, kun he kiistelivät keskenään.
null.verse 3:44: Ja katso, enkelit sanoivat: »Maria, Jumala ilmoittaa sinulle hyvän sanoman, että hänen Sanansa tulee sinulle.
null.verse 3:45: Hän on puhuva ihmisille kehdostaan samoin kuin täysiikäisenä ja on oleva yksi vanhurskaista.
null.verse 3:46: Maria sanoi: »Herra, kuinka minä voin saada lapsen, kun ei yksikään ihminen ole minuun koskenut?» Enkeli vastasi: »Jumala luo, mitä tahtoo; kun hän päättää jonkun asian, sanoo hän vain: 'Tapahtukoon!' ja niin tapahtuu.
null.verse 3:47: Ja Jumala on opettava hänelle Pyhän kirjan, viisauden, Lain ja Evankeliumin
null.verse 3:48: ja lähettävä hänet profeetaksi israelilaisten luo.
null.verse 3:49: Samoin tulen vahvistamaan todeksi sen, mikä on ollut ennen minua kirjoitettuna Laissa, ja sallimaan teille osan siitä, mikä tähän asti on ollut teiltä kiellettyä, niin, minä tulen luoksenne tuoden tunnusmerkit Herraltanne.
null.verse 3:50: Jumala on totisesti minun Herrani ja teidän Herranne, palvelkaa siis Häntä.
null.verse 3:51: Ja kun Jeesus havaitsi heissä epäuskoa, sanoi hän: »Ketkä haluavat olla minun seuraajiani Jumalan työssä?» Opetuslapset vastasivat: »Me olemme Jumalan seuraajia, me uskomme Jumalaan; todista, että olemme Hänen tahtoonsa ja johtoonsa alistuneet.
null.verse 3:52: Herramme, Me uskomme siihen, mitä olet ilmoittanut, ja me seuraamme Sinun profeettaasi; merkitse meidät siis tunnustajien joukkoon.
null.verse 3:53: He (epäuskoiset juutalaiset) juonittelivat, mutta Jumalakin juonitteli (heitä vastaan); ja Jumala on todella taitavin Suunnittelija.
null.verse 3:54: Ja Jumala sanoi: »Jeesus, katso, Minä otan sinut, sitten olen ylentävä sinut luokseni ja vapauttava sinut niistä, jotka ovat uskottomia, sekä asettava ne, jotka sinua seuraavat, uskottomien yläpuolelle aina Ylösnousemuksen päivään saakka.
null.verse 3:55: Mitä niihin tulee, jotka eivät uskoneet, olen kurittava heitä raskaalla rangaistuksella sekä tässä että tulevassa elämässä; eivätkä he löydä ketään auttajaa.
null.verse 3:56: Mutta uskovaisille ja hyviä töitä harjoittaville Hän on antava heidän täyden palkkansa.
null.verse 3:57: Tämän me julistamme sinulle Muhammed, tunnusmerkkinä ja viisauden tietona, jotka ovat Koraanissa.
null.verse 3:58: Katso, Jeesus on Jumalan edessä samankaltainen kuin Aadam; Hän loi hänet (Aadamin) maan tomusta, sitten Hän sanoi hänelle: »Ole!» ja hän oli (elävä sielu).
null.verse 3:59: Tämä totuus tulee Herraltasi, Muhammed, siksi älä kuulu epäileviin.
null.verse 3:60: Jos joku tästä kiistelee kanssasi, sen jälkeen kuin (tämä täydellinen) tieto on osaksesi tullut, niin sano: »Tulkaa, kutsukaamme meidän poikamme ja teidän poikanne, meidän vaimomme ja teidän vaimonne, kokoontukaamme me itse ja te itse; ja sitten kukin velvoittakaamme itsemme Jumalan edessä ja huutakaamme Jumalan kirousta niiden yli, jotka valehtelevat!»
null.verse 3:61: Katso, tämä sanoma on kauttaaltaan totuutta, eikä ole muuta jumalaa kuin Jumala; Hän on totisesti mahtava, viisas.
null.verse 3:62: Mutta jos he kääntyvät pois, niin totisesti Jumala tuntee turmeluksen aiheuttajat.
null.verse 3:63: Sano (juutalaisille ja kristityille) : »Te Pyhän kirjan omistajat, tulkaa yhteisymmärrykseen meidän kanssamme (uskonnon asiasta), että meillä olisi samoin kuin teilläkin, ettemme palvele muuta kuin ainoata Jumalaa emmekä aseta ketään Hänen rinnalleen, emmekä kukaan pidä toistamme herrana, (emme pidä herrana ketään muuta) paitsi Jumalaa.
null.verse 3:64: Te Pyhän kirjan omistavat, miksi te kiistelette Aabrahamista? Laki ja Evankeliumihan lähetettiin vasta hänen jälkeensä 9); eikö teillä ole ymmärrystä?
null.verse 3:65: Kuulkaa, jospa kiistelisitte sellaisesta, josta teillä on tietoa; mutta miksi kiistelette sellaisesta, josta teillä ei ole tietoa? Jumala tietää, mutta te ette tiedä.
null.verse 3:66: Aabraham ei ollut juutalainen eikä kristitty, vaan hän oli hurskas (haniifi) ja Jumalalle alamainen (muslimi) eikä kuulunut monijumalaisiin.
null.verse 3:67: Ihmisiä, jotka voivat lähinnä vedota Aabrahamiin, ovat totisesti ne, jotka seuraavat Häntä kuten tämäkin profeetta (Muhammed), ja ne, jotka (hänen kerallaan) uskovat; ja Jumala on uskovaisten Suojelija.
null.verse 3:68: Eräät niistä, jotka ovat saaneet Pyhän kirjan, toivoisivat voivansa eksyttää teidät, mutta he eivät eksytä ketään muita kuin juuri itsensä, eivätkä he aavista sitä.
null.verse 3:69: Te, joilla on Pyhä kirja, miksi ette usko Jumalan tunnusmerkkeihin, vaikka itse olette niiden silminnäkijöitä?
null.verse 3:70: Te, joilla on Pyhä kirja, miksi verhoatte totuuden valheella ja salaatte totuuden vastoin parempaa tietoanne?
null.verse 3:71: Osa niistä, jotka ovat saaneet Pyhän kirjan, sanoo: »Uskokaa päivän noustessa siihen, mikä on ilmoitettu uskovaisille (muslimeille), ja kieltäkää se päivän päättyessä; näin ehkä saamme heidät puolellemme.
null.verse 3:72: Älkää uskoko muita kuin uskontoanne todella noudattavia! - Sano: »Oikea johdatus on totisesti Jumalan johdatus».
null.verse 3:73: Hän antaa laupeutensa sille, kenet Hän valitsee.
null.verse 3:74: Niiden keskuudessa, jotka ovat saaneet Pyhän kirjan, on sellaisia, että jos uskot heille säilytettäväksi suuren määrän kultaa, he palauttavat sen sinulle, ja heidän keskuudessaan on sellaisiakin, jotka, jos uskot heille denaarin, eivät palauta sitä sinulle, ellet sitä vaatimalla vaadi.
null.verse 3:75: Ei niin, vaan ainoastaan se on (Jumalan edessä hurskas), joka täyttää velvollisuutensa ja karttaa pahaa.
null.verse 3:76: Totisesti niillä, jotka liittonsa Jumalan kanssa ja valansa vaihtavat vähäpätöisiin arvoihin, ei tule olemaan autuutta tulevassa elämässä.
null.verse 3:77: Katso, heidän joukossaan on sellaisia, jotka puhuessaan vääristelevät Pyhää kirjaa, jotta te luulisitte Pyhän kirjan sanoiksi sellaistakin, mikä siihen ei sisälly; he sanovat: »Se tulee Jumalalta», vaikka se ei tule Jumalalta, ja vedoten Jumalaan he valehtelevat vastoin parempaa tietoaan.
null.verse 3:78: Ei voi ihminen, jolle Jumala on antanut Pyhän kirjan, viisauden ja profeetantehtävän, sanoa ihmisille: »Olkaa minun palvelijoitani samalla tavalla, kuin olette Jumalan palvelijoita».
null.verse 3:79: Eikä hän käske teitä ottamaan enkeleitä tai profeettoja herroiksenne.
null.verse 3:80: Aikoinaan, kun Jumala teki liiton profeettojen kanssa, Hän sanoi: »Katso, näin paljon annan teille Pyhiä kirjoituksia ja viisautta, ja sitten tulee lähettiläs ja vahvistaa todeksi sen, mikä teillä jo on; teidän on totisesti uskottava häneen ja autettava häntä».
null.verse 3:81: Senvuoksi ketkä ikinä tämän jälkeen luopuvat, he ovat jumalattomia.
null.verse 3:82: Jotakin muuta Jumalan uskontoako he vielä etsisivät, vaikka kaikki taivaassa ja maan päällä ovat Hänelle alamaisia tahtoen tai tahtomattaan, ja Hänen luokseen on heidän palattava?
null.verse 3:83: Sano: »Me uskomme Jumalaan, siihen, mitä on ylhäältä ilmoitettu meille ja mitä on ilmoitettu Aabrahamille, Ismaelille, Iisakille ja Jaakobille sekä (Israelin) sukukunnille, siihen, mitä Mooses, Jeesus ja profeetat ovat saaneet Herraltansa; me emme tee mitään erotusta heidän välillään, ja Hänen tahtoonsa ja johdatukseensa olemme alistuneet».
null.verse 3:84: Mutta jos joku pitää uskontonaan jotakin muuta kuin Islaamia , niin Jumala ei sitä koskaan hyväksy, ja kuoleman jälkeen hän on joutuva kadotettujen joukkoon.
null.verse 3:85: Kuinka Jumala ohjaisi ihmisiä, jotka ovat tulleet uskottomiksi, senjälkeen kuin he olivat uskossa ja tunnustivat Muhammedin oikeaksi profeetaksi ja (Jumalan kaikkivallan) selvät todistukset heille näytettiin? Jumala ei ohjaa jumalattomia ihmisiä.
null.verse 3:86: Näiden palkaksi tulee Jumalan, enkelien ja ihmisten kirous.
null.verse 3:87: Sen alaisiksi he jäävät ikuisesti, heidän rangaistustaan ei lievennetä eikä heihin kiinnitetä (sen enempää) huomiota.
null.verse 3:88: (Tästä kohtalosta vapautuvat vain ne), jotka myöhemmin katuvat ja tekevät parannuksen, sillä Jumala on sääliväinen ja laupias.
null.verse 3:89: Mutta jotka oltuaan uskossa ovat tulleet uskottomiksi ja sitten yhä yltyvät uskottomuudessaan, niiden kääntymystä ei totisesti hyväksytä; he jäävät eksyneiksi.
null.verse 3:90: Niistä, jotka ovat olleet uskottomia ja kuolevat epäuskossaan, ei yhdenkään sielun lunnaiksi hyväksytä edes koko maailman täyttä kultaa, heitä odottaa tuskallinen rangaistus, eivätkä he löydä ketään puoltajaa.
null.verse 3:91: Ette koskaan saavuta tosihurskautta, ennenkuin uhraatte sellaista, mikä on teille rakasta; ja mitä uhraattekin, Jumala sen tietää totisesti.
null.verse 3:92: Ennenkuin Laki annettiin ylhäältä, oli kaikki ruoka sallittu israelilaisille paitsi se, minkä Israel itse kielsi itseltään.
null.verse 3:93: Ja ketkä tämän jälkeen sepittävät valheita Jumalaan vedoten, ne ovat väärintekijöitä, jumalattomia.
null.verse 3:94: Sano: »Jumalan puhe on totuutta; noudattakaa siis Aabrahamin oppia, koska hän oli hurskas (haniifi) eikä kuulunut monijumalaisiin.
null.verse 3:95: Ensimmäinen rukoushuone, joka perustettiin ihmisille, oli totisesti se, joka on Bekassa (Mekassa) siunauksena ja opastuksena koko maailmalle.
null.verse 3:96: Siellä on ilmeisiä tunnusmerkkejä: Aabrahamin rukouspaikka; ja se, joka astuu sinne, on varmassa turvassa.
null.verse 3:97: Sano: »Te, jotka omistatte Pyhän kirjan, miksi ette usko Jumalan tunnusmerkkeihin, vaikka Jumala on teidän tekojenne todistaja?
null.verse 3:98: Sano: »Te, joilla on Pyhä kirja, miksi työnnätte uskovaisia pois Jumalan tieltä ja pyritte tekemään sen mutkikkaaksi, vaikka olette varmoja (sen suoruudesta)? Mutta Jumala ei ole välinpitämätön siitä, mitä te teette.
